0.title: Premier League solely responsible for Superleague idea: Ex-Bayern CEO
0.article_body: Former Bayern Munich CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge has claimed that it is the Premier League's six richest clubs that were responsible for the controversial European Superleague last year. "The big instigator is solely England. This idea came about because of the income in the Premier League," said Rummenigge. Bayern Munich was the biggest club that refused to participate in the Superleague.

1.title: I'd have probably got Shami instead of Harshal: Kris on India's T20 WC squad
1.article_body: Commenting on India's 15-member squad for upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said he would've probably picked pacer Mohammad Shami instead of Harshal Patel. "We're playing in Australia, the guy [Shami] has got the real action...bounce...he can get on early wickets," he added. Shami has been named as a standby for the World Cup.

2.title: Why Marathi Manoos have been thrown out from Mumbai?: CM Shinde to Uddhav
2.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has "challenged" former CM Uddhav Thackeray to "publish the statistics of how many" Marathi speaking people are "left in Mumbai". "For many years they (Thackeray-led Sena) kept seeking votes in the name of Marathi people. You should answer why the Marathi Manoos have been thrown out from Mumbai to the outskirts like Virar," he said.

3.title: Woman saved while crossing train track risks life again for water bottle in UP
3.article_body: A video has shown a woman being rescued while crossing train tracks in UP and then risking her life again to get her water bottle. An IRTS officer shared the video which showed the woman getting the bottle kept at the edge of the platform, just as the train went by. "Such people should be fined," said a Twitter user.

4.title: Sikandar Raza creates history, becomes 1st player from Zimbabwe to win ICC monthly award
4.article_body: All-rounder Sikandar Raza has created history by becoming the first Zimbabwe player to win the ICC Men's Player of the Month award. Raza beat New Zealand all-rounder Mitchell Santner and England all-rounder Ben Stokes to claim the monthly award for August, with the 36-year-old scoring three ODI centuries during the month alone. "I'm incredibly humbled and honoured," Raza said.

5.title: Messi, Mbappe among highest ranked in FIFA 23 as Ronaldo slips below
5.article_body: Lionel Messi, Karim Benzema, Robert Lewandowski, Kylian Mbappe and Kevin De Bruyne are the highest-ranked players with 91 points in EA Sports' FIFA 23 game. Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo features among the second-highest scorers with 90 points. Liverpool players Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk have also been marked at par with Ronaldo, while PSG's Neymar has 89 points.

6.title: Kejriwal has dinner at Guj auto driver's home after police stops him on way
6.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Monday had dinner at the house of an auto-rickshaw driver, who had invited him earlier in the day, in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Kejriwal was earlier stopped by Gujarat Police from visiting the driver's house, citing security reasons. "We don't want your security...You've held us hostage," Kejriwal said, while arguing with a police officer.

7.title: God save him from the evil eye: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq on Babar Azam
7.article_body: Talking about Babar Azam, who scored 68 runs in six Asia Cup 2022 matches, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said, "Anybody with a deep eye of cricket will realise...he's unlucky with the way he's getting out." He added, "The way he plays and his work ethic needs no further discussion. He's a world-class player and God save him from...evil eye."

8.title: Man calls Queen's son Andrew 'sick old man' at funeral procession, arrested; video out
8.article_body: A man was arrested on Monday for heckling Queen Elizabeth's son Prince Andrew during her funeral procession in Scotland's Edinburgh. The incident happened when King Charles and Prince Andrew followed the Queen's coffin that was being brought to St Giles' Cathedral. "Andrew, you're a sick old man," shouted the heckler. Prince Andrew has been accused of sexual assault.

9.title: Pickpockets also join Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala
9.article_body: While the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala drew a crowd of thousands of people, it also drew in pickpockets. A police officer said that pickpocketing incidents were reported in some areas and after examining the CCTV footage, they identified a gang of four people. "Not sure if...they were behind the reported incidents of pickpocketing," the officer said.

10.title: Six-year-old girl raped by 22-year-old man in Ranchi
10.article_body: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 22-year-old man in Jharkhand's Ranchi district. The accused had allegedly lured the victim with chocolates before committing the crime, police said. "The accused was arrested based on a complaint lodged at Namkum Police Station. The girl has been sent for medical examination," said Ranchi Superintendent of Police (Rural) Naushad Alam.

11.title: Akshay Kumar's hairdresser Milan passes away, actor says 'Still can't believe you left us'
11.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to condole the demise of his hairdresser Milan Jadhav. Akshay wrote, "You stood out of the crowd with your funky hairstyles and infectious smile. Always ensured not even one hair of mine was out of place." He added, "The life of the set...my hairdresser for more than 15 years...Still can’t believe you’ve left us."

12.title: Dreams do come true: Dinesh Karthik on being included in India's T20 World Cup squad
12.article_body: After being included in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Dreams do come true." The last time Karthik was included in India's T20 World Cup squad was for the 2010 edition. The 37-year-old has played 50 T20Is for India so far, scoring 592 runs at a strike rate of 139.95.

13.title: Salman meets Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur during latter's 180 days fast
13.article_body: Salman Khan recently met Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur during the latter's 180 days of fasting. According to followers of Acharya, the actor sought blessings from the monk and he also learnt various aspects and rituals of Jainism. Reportedly, the 56-year-old Jain monk ended his 180 days of continuous fasting on Sunday, September 11.

14.title: We played to get result in shortened 3rd Test: Stokes after win over SA
14.article_body: After England won the third Test by nine wickets and clinched the three-match series 2-1 against South Africa, England skipper Ben Stokes said his side's main aim was to get a result after the Test was shortened at The Oval. Play was suspended on Day 2 after Queen Elizabeth II's demise. England's Ollie Robinson was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

15.title: MeitY Startup Hub & Meta collaborate to accelerate XR tech startups
15.article_body: MeitY Startup Hub, an initiative of the Ministry of Electronics and IT, will collaborate with Facebook's parent company, Meta, to accelerate and support XR (Extended Reality) technology startups in India. In a statement, the Ministry said, "This collaboration is part of the government's efforts for skilling in emerging and future technologies." The programme will be launched on September 13.

16.title: SGPC holds protests in Punjab demanding release of Sikh prisoners
16.article_body: The SGPC, India's apex gurdwara body, on Monday staged protests at various places in Punjab, demanding the release of Sikh prisoners who have "completed their sentence". It has called for the release of several Sikh prisoners, including those arrested in connection with terror and separatist activities. SGPC has alleged discrimination against such prisoners with respect to the grant of remission.

17.title: Arti Singh says she lost 5 kg in 18 days, shares transformation video
17.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and actress Arti Singh took to Instagram and shared a transformation video of herself in which she can be seen working out. "18 days. 71.21 kg to 66.84 kg...Not giving up," Arti wrote along with the video. Reacting to the video, actress Rashmi Desai commented, "Proud of you babe." Several fans also reacted to her post.

18.title: Rajamouli was paid ₹10 cr to promote Brahmastra's Telugu version: Reports
18.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli reportedly received ₹10 crore from producer Karan Johar for the promotions of the Telugu version of 'Brahmastra'. The 'RRR' director promoted and presented the film in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. According to reports, the Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer film has been made on a budget of ₹410 crore.

19.title: Bessemer Venture Partners closes 2 funds at $4.6 bn to back startups
19.article_body: Venture capital firm Bessemer Venture Partners (BVP) has closed $4.6 billion in new capital for two funds, the BVP XII and BVP Forge Fund, to back startups. The BVP XII fund will focus on seed and early-stage investments, while the Forge Fund will focus on growth buyout. BVP claims to have more than $20 billion in Assets Under Management (AUM).

20.title: India's agri-food products export up 30% in first 4 months of FY23
20.article_body: India's overall export of agricultural and processed food products increased by 30% to $9.59 billion in the first four months (April-July) of FY23 compared to the corresponding period of FY 2021-22, DGCI&S data showed. Further, the export of fresh fruits and vegetables registered a 4% growth, while processed fruits and vegetables recorded a 51% growth in the April-July period.

21.title: Used to get around ₹1-1.5 lakh for full film in 80s: Mandakini
21.article_body: Veteran actress Mandakini, who made her debut in 1985, said in an interview that actresses were not "very much in demand" in those days, adding that they were "used only for a few songs and romantic scenes". "When we used to work in films, we used to earn around ₹1-1.5 lakh for the full film," Mandakini further said.

22.title: 6 Syrian refugees found dead on boat reaching Italian port
22.article_body: Six Syrian refugees, including three children, were found dead on a migrant boat that arrived in the Italian port of Pozzallo on Monday, the UNHCR said. "They died of thirst, hunger and severe burns," UNHCR's representative to Italy stated. As per the UN agency, the deceased were among those 26 people who had been on the boat for several days.

23.title: Don't know why Babar was dragging the match: Moin Khan
23.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Moin Khan has questioned skipper Babar Azam's captaincy in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka. "We (Pakistan) should have attacked with our main bowlers, the fast bowlers. That's what common sense says," Moin said. He added, "I don't know why Babar was dragging the match...I guess he started thinking about the final overs. That's negative thinking."

24.title: Hope to never play another Spaniard in a Grand Slam final: Casper Ruud
24.article_body: Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said he hoped he didn't have to play any Spanish player in a Grand Slam final. "They know what they're doing in the Slam finals," said Ruud. The world number two lost to Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open 2022 final and earlier in the year lost the French Open final to Rafael Nadal.

25.title: UP govt demolishes 'illegal' madrasa in Amethi
25.article_body: A madrasa, which was built "illegally" on government land, was demolished in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh. The madrasa was built on grazing land along the Banda-Tanda highway in 2009, Amethi DM Rakesh Kumar Mishra said. A fine of ₹2.24 lakh has been imposed on the building's owner. The madrasa was built with the intention to grab the land, officials said.

26.title: Was called hanger in school for being too skinny: Tejasswi Prakash
26.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash revealed that she was called a "hanger" in her school days as she was too skinny. "When we used to play on our school's playground...people used to tell me 'Keep a ₹5 coin in your pocket or you'll fly away'," she added. The actress, who is also the winner of 'Bigg Boss 15', features in 'Naagin 6'.

27.title: Future is here: Roddick after 19-yr-old Alcaraz's 1st-ever Grand Slam title
27.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz following his first-ever Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, Andy Roddick said, "Future is here. What a pleasure it's been to see Alcaraz improve so quickly." He added, "Youngest number one in the history of our game...As mature/nice off the court as he is dynamic on it. Cheers to the first of many majors Carlitos!"

28.title: After Apple, Google plans to make Pixel phones in India: Report
28.article_body: Amid supply disruptions due to COVID-19 restrictions in China, Google is planning to shift some production of Pixel phones to India, a report said. Google has reportedly asked Indian manufacturers to submit bids for the assembly of five lakh-ten lakh units of its Pixel smartphones. Earlier, a report said that Apple is planning to begin manufacturing iPhone 14 in India.

29.title: Asia Cup 2022 ends as a nightmare tournament for Babar, Fakhar: Akhtar
29.article_body: Criticising Pakistan captain Babar Azam and batter Fakhar Zaman, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said the Asia Cup 2022 "ends a nightmare tournament for Babar as a batter. Same disaster for Fakhar". He added, "This combination is not working. Pakistan has to look into a lot of things." In six matches, Babar and Zaman scored 68 and 96 runs respectively.

30.title: On-field conditions were not up to mark in 1st T20I vs England: Mandhana
30.article_body: Talking about India Women-England Women first T20I, India opener Smriti Mandhana said the on-field conditions in Chester-le-Street were not up to the mark to hold an international match. "As a team, we did have a discussion because we didn't play the brand of cricket that we've been playing for...last two months," she added. India lost the match by nine wickets.

31.title: Why doesn't BJP use agencies to find out who's not Indian?: Baghel on CAA
31.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) targets the poor and underprivileged and asked why BJP doesn't "use [central] agencies to find out who's not an Indian". "CAA means that I have to prove that I am an Indian...It's not just about the Muslims, Muslims are very smart and have kept all their documents properly," Baghel added.

32.title: TMC to bring resolution in Assembly against 'misuse' of ED, CBI
32.article_body: The Trinamool Congress, led by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, will bring a resolution in the state Assembly against the "misuse" of central agencies like ED and CBI. "They are being used by the Centre to harass non-BJP governments in various states," Parliamentary Affairs Minister Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay said. He added that Opposition BJP may take part in the discussion.

33.title: Rat's head found in food ordered from restaurant, claims TN family; probe launched
33.article_body: A family in Tamil Nadu's Arani has claimed that they found a 'rat's head' in a beetroot fry parcel delivered by a restaurant on Sunday. The family had ordered 35 parcels of food for their guests who had assembled at their house for a condolence event. After the restaurant denied the allegations, police sent the food for testing.

34.title: Kabir Singh became family film despite being edgy, aggressive: Shahid
34.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his 2019 film 'Kabir Singh', has said that it was "technically" an adult film. "The number of people who have liked it and watched it with their families is unbelievable. Somehow, it made it to the family space despite being edgy and aggressive," he stated. Actress Kiara Advani had featured in the film.

35.title: 4,449 families evicted across Assam under current BJP-led govt's tenure
35.article_body: A total of 4,449 families have been evicted across Assam for alleged encroachment since BJP's Himanta Biswa Sarma was elected as Chief Minister in May 2021. Sarma said the government hasn't carried out any investigation on whether the evicted families were Indian or not. We're not aware if evicted families were homeless people due to erosion, Sarma added.

36.title: Abrdn Plc to sell 43 mn shares in HDFC Life via block deal: Report
36.article_body: Edinburg-based finance and insurance company Abrdn Plc is expected to sell 43 million shares in HDFC Life Insurance Company in the price band of ₹564-578.5 per share, a report quoting sources said. The deal is likely to happen through a block deal. The insurance company is also expected to raise up to $313 million through the sale of the shares.

37.title: Prabhas to burn Ravan's effigy at Delhi's Lav Kush Ramleela this year
37.article_body: Actor Prabhas will burn the effigy of Ravan at the Lav Kush Ramleela in Delhi this year. The festivities will commence on September 26 and will conclude on October 5. "Since Prabhas is already playing role of Lord Rama in 'Adipurush'...who better than him to set...evilness of Raavan on fire this Dussehra," Lav Kush Ramleela committee head Arjun Kumar said.

38.title: Which 6 Indians from last year's T20 WC squad don't feature in T20 WC 2022 squad?
38.article_body: As many as six Indian players, who featured in India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, are not a part of T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Ravindra Jadeja doesn't feature in the squad as he is recuperating from a knee injury. The other five players are Rahul Chahar, Varun Chakaravarthy, Ishan Kishan, Mohammad Shami and Shardul Thakur.

39.title: Shabana attends 'What's Love...' screening at TIFF, shares pics
39.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi recently attended the screening of her film 'What's Love Got to Do with It?' at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). She took to Instagram to share a few pictures where she can be seen posing with her co-stars Lily James and Sajal Aly. It is a British romantic comedy directed by Indian director Shekhar Kapur.

40.title: Cong cannot be wished away, have more seats than regional parties: Tejashwi
40.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said that they "cannot wish away the fact" that Congress' numbers are higher than RJD and other regional parties in the Parliament. "Others (parties) are...limited to their own states," Yadav said. He added, "Their (BJP) strength has already come down after the JD(U)'s departure...If we join hands...then BJP will...stop short of the halfway mark."

41.title: What is the IPL team-wise distribution of India’s T20 World Cup 2022 squad?
41.article_body: India's 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022 was announced on Monday. Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bangalore have the joint-highest representation in the squad among IPL teams, with three players each. They're followed by Delhi Capitals, Lucknow Super Giants and Rajasthan Royals, with two players each. One player each from SunRisers Hyderabad, Punjab Kings and Gujarat Titans is included.

42.title: Mom said it's okay if I freeze my eggs or be single mother: Mrunal
42.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, during a conversation with Shriya Pilgaonkar, was asked if she has people in her life who make her aware of her "ticking biological clock". To this, she replied, "There are times when I feel I want to have a baby." Mrunal revealed her mother said it's okay if she freezes her eggs or becomes a single mother.

43.title: 5 aides of Nigerian lawmaker killed in attack on convoy
43.article_body: Five aides of a Nigerian Senator were killed when unidentified gunmen attacked his convoy in Anambra state on Sunday evening, the lawmaker's spokesman said. Senator Ifeanyi Ubah escaped unhurt as he was travelling in a bullet-proof vehicle, the spokesman informed. Separatist group Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) has been previously accused by the government of carrying out such attacks.

44.title: India's Jehan Daruvala wins Formula 2 feature race at Monza, finishes 3rd in sprint race
44.article_body: India's Jehan Daruvala won the Formula 2 feature race at Monza and finished third in the sprint race at the track. "Yesss, P1...A big thanks to the boys and girls @PREMA_Team - the car was rapid and the pit-stop amazing...Feels good to go into the break with a double podium under my belt!" he tweeted.

45.title: We smile knowing you & grandpa are reunited: Harry in 1st statement on Queen's death
45.article_body: Prince Harry on Monday released his first statement on Queen Elizabeth's death and addressed her directly, saying, "Granny...You are already sorely missed, not just by us, but by the world over." He said, "Thank you for your commitment to service...Thank you for your infectious smile. We, too, smile knowing that you and grandpa are reunited now."

46.title: I shouldn't have made Dhaakad: Hansal to user saying 'you gave Kangana a flop'
46.article_body: Hansal Mehta reacted after a Twitter user accused him of giving Kangana Ranaut a flop film after the filmmaker praised 'Brahmastra' on the social media platform. The user wrote, "Shame on you. You gave a flop film to Kangana." To this, he replied, "I shouldn't have made 'Dhaakad'." 'Dhaakad' was directed by Razneesh Ghai and had failed to perform.

47.title: Congress will not weaken itself for Opposition unity: Jairam Ramesh
47.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said Opposition unity for 2024 "doesn't mean weakening" the party. "Our allies should also understand that we will not allow ourselves to be weakened further...A strong Congress is an important pillar of Opposition unity," said Ramesh. He added that the BJP is "rattled" by seeing the support that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and Rahul Gandhi are getting.

48.title: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal's Navi Technologies gets SEBI nod for ₹3,350 cr IPO
48.article_body: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal's fintech startup Navi Technologies has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for a ₹3,350 crore Initial Public Offering (IPO). Navi Technologies submitted its draft papers in March 2022. The company reported a profit of ₹71.1 crore in FY21 and incurred losses of ₹206.42 crore in the first nine months of FY22.

49.title: Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Tyagi granted bail by SC
49.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday granted bail to Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Narayan Tyagi. The court asked him not to make any statement in the media with regard to the pending case. Tyagi, along with Yati Narsinghanand, was accused of hurting religious sentiments after videos of their speeches at Dharma Sansad surfaced on social media.

50.title: Iran says it has developed drone designed to hit Israeli cities
50.article_body: Iran has developed an advanced long-range suicide drone capable of striking Israeli cities, the chief of Iranian ground forces said, as per a semi-official news agency. "We have specially designed this drone for Haifa and Tel Aviv," Brigadier General Kioumars Heidari stated. "We will reveal its capabilities in future drills," he added. The drone has been named 'Arash-2', Heidari informed.

51.title: 10 dead so far after poll candidate distributes hooch in U'khand
51.article_body: Two more persons who fell ill after consuming illicit liquor distributed by a panchayat election candidate in Uttarakhand have died, taking the total number of deaths in the case to 10, police said. Two other persons are currently undergoing treatment. Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has ordered a magisterial probe into the incident.

52.title: Over 67,000 cattle died since July due to lumpy skin disease: Centre
52.article_body: The Centre said over 67,000 cattle have died since July due to the lumpy skin disease with the 'goat pox' vaccine still being used. "In Rajasthan, the number of death is 600-700 per day...in other states, it is less than 100," said an official. A new 'Lumpi-ProVacInd' vaccine will take three-four months to be commercially available, added the official.

53.title: She kept her promises with dignity: Olivia Colman on Queen Elizabeth II
53.article_body: Actress Olivia Colman, speaking about Queen Elizabeth II's legacy, has said, "She made a promise as a young woman and she absolutely kept it with such dignity." Olivia played Queen Elizabeth II in two seasons of the series 'The Crown'. The actress further said that King Charles III is going to do a good job. Queen passed away on Thursday.

54.title: SL played superb, hard luck for Pak in Asia Cup final: Afghanistan's Gurbaz
54.article_body: Afghanistan opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz took to Twitter following Sri Lanka's Asia Cup win and wrote, "Congratulations to Sri Lanka...They played superb. Hard luck for Pakistan. It was a good tournament for all the teams to prepare for T20 World Cup 2022." Notably, Afghanistan were the only team to defeat Sri Lanka in the tournament. Sri Lanka beat Pakistan in final.

55.title: Air India to get 30 new planes in 1st big expansion since acquisition
55.article_body: Air India has signed agreements for 25 Airbus and five Boeing aircraft which will enter service in late 2022. Marking the airline's first major fleet expansion since its acquisition by the Tata Group, the Boeings will be deployed on existing routes between India and US. The airline will also offer Premium Economy flights for the first time on international flights.

56.title: Govt plans ₹20,000 cr aid to oil firms hit by rising costs: Report
56.article_body: Government is planning to pay around ₹20,000 crore to the state-run fuel retailers to compensate them for losses and keep a check on cooking gas prices, a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. Oil Ministry has reportedly sought a ₹28,000 crore-compensation, but the Finance Ministry is agreeing for only ₹20,000-crore. The talks are reportedly at an advanced stage.

57.title: Conspiracy against me: Punjab minister after 'extortion' audio clip goes viral
57.article_body: An audio clip of a conversation allegedly between Punjab minister Fauja Singh Sarari and his close aide has surfaced online in which the duo can be purportedly heard discussing a plan to extort money from officials and transporters. "The audio clip is fake and is a conspiracy against me," the minister said, while demanding action against those circulating the clip.

58.title: It’s a powerful action drama: Milap Zaveri on his upcoming directorial
58.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming directorial, Milap Zaveri has said that it is a work in progress. "It's a powerful action drama and will go on floors next year," he added. Along with his directorial, Milap revealed, "I'm also writing the story, screenplay and dialogues for Mohit Suri's next." He added, "I'm also penning the screenplay...dialogues for Remo D'Souza's next film."

59.title: Roman Reigns would smash MS Dhoni's numbers on cricket field, says WWE's Paul Heyman
59.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman took to Instagram Stories to react to a news article which recalled how he had asked ICC for royalties for allegedly paraphrasing his mantra 'Eat. Sleep. Conquer. Repeat' to praise MS Dhoni. He wrote, "For the record...my Tribal Chief...Reigns would smash Dhoni's numbers on the cricket field...and that's something everyone should acknowledge!"

60.title: Police conducts flag march in Ayodhya after Gyanvapi case verdict
60.article_body: Police conducted a flag march in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya after the Varanasi district court's verdict on the Gyanvapi case on Monday. The Varanasi court agreed to hear a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of the Hindu side's plea.

61.title: Criminal who escaped from jail caught by villagers in Meghalaya
61.article_body: A day after four of the six undertrial prisoners, who had escaped from a jail in Meghalaya, were lynched by a mob, villagers on Monday caught the fifth criminal and handed him over to the police. The prisoner was allegedly tied up and paraded through the village, as per reports. The sixth prisoner is yet to be apprehended.

62.title: E-auction of 10 commercial coal mines to start tomorrow: Ministry
62.article_body: Coal Ministry has said that e-auction for 10 coal mines will be launched on Tuesday, adding that technical evaluation of bids has been completed, a PIB release said. E-auction for the mines will be conducted on two days, i.e., Tuesday and Wednesday. Total peak rate capacity of the mines being put up for e-auction is 39.31 million tons per annum.

63.title: Event celebrating men's divorce cancelled after protest in MP, pic of invite viral
63.article_body: An event to celebrate the divorce of 18 men, organised by NGO Bhai Welfare Society in MP's Bhopal, has been cancelled following protests. A card inviting people to the event, earlier scheduled to be held on September 18, had gone viral online. The invite mentioned various activities for the event like 'Jaimala Visarjan' and 'Gents Sangeet'.

64.title: Pune auto associations ask RTO to allow charging as per tariff card
64.article_body: The Pune autorickshaw associations have demanded that the RTO authorities allow them to charge customers as per new tariff card rates since the RTO is yet to calibrate some auto meters. The revised rates came into effect in Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Baramati from September 1. Of the 94,000 autorickshaws in Pune district, only 30,000 have been calibrated till now.

65.title: I often buy a lot of cheap things, the middle class in me hasn't gone: Rakul
65.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh in an interview said she often buys a lot of cheap things, adding, "I'm quite cheap that way...that middle class in me hasn't gone." She added she doesn't shop "with the price tag". "If I like something I'll pick it up from...normal brand...if I like something on high street I'll pick it up from there," said Rakul.

66.title: Rename new Parliament building after BR Ambedkar: T'gana CM to Centre
66.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said a resolution will be passed in the state Assembly, urging the Centre to rename the new Parliament building after BR Ambedkar. "(Ambedkar is) among people who made great efforts for welfare of downtrodden," KCR said. Telangana wouldn't have been formed if it weren't for a section that Ambedkar added in the Constitution, he added.

67.title: Amazon India marketplace revenue rises over 30%, net loss narrows
67.article_body: Amazon Seller Services, which runs Amazon India marketplace, recorded over a 30% rise in operational revenue, and its net loss narrowed in FY22 to ₹3,649 crore from ₹4,748 crore in FY21. Last year, Amazon Seller Services reported a 50% rise in revenue. Amazon Pay India, which runs payments services in India, reported a 16% rise in revenue from last year.

68.title: Vikram attends wedding of his house help's son, pics surface
68.article_body: Actor Vikram, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, recently attended the wedding of his house help's son at the Thiruporur Kandaswamy Temple in Tamil Nadu. Several pictures of Vikram in a white shirt and mundu have also surfaced online. The actor, known for films like 'I' and 'Anniyan', was recently seen in 'Cobra'.

69.title: Same path as that of Babri Masjid: Owaisi on court order in Gyanvapi case
69.article_body: We're going on the same path as that of the Babri Masjid issue, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said while reacting to Varanasi district court's order in the Gyanvapi case. The court has rejected the plea questioning maintainability of civil suits challenging Gyanvapi mosque's title. After this order, purpose of Places of Worship Act 1991 will fail, Owaisi added.

70.title: Centre mulls additional LPG subsidy of up to ₹30,000 crore: Report
70.article_body: The Centre is considering an additional subsidy of up to ₹30,000 crore to keep the retail price of LPG in check, CNBC TV18 reported. The additional subsidy will reportedly be "over and above" the budget earmarked for the Centre's Ujjwala scheme. The estimated amount is higher than the ₹5,812 crore marked as LPG subsidy in the budget estimate for FY23.

71.title: Noida projected to have 620 electric bikes by December end
71.article_body: By the end of December, 62 docking stations across Noida will be home to a total of 620 electric bicycles. Ten e-bicycles will be available at each station during the pilot programme started by the Noida Authority. The docking stations' locations include Sector 6 Noida Authority office, the Sectors 15, 16 and 18 metro stations and Botanical Garden, among others.

72.title: HC directs filing of PIL over deaths of 2 manual scavengers in Delhi
72.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed that a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) be filed over the deaths of two manual scavengers in Delhi's Mundka. The court took suo motu cognisance of the deaths that resulted from them inhaling toxic gases inside a sewer while cleaning a drain. A case was registered under section 304A of the Indian Penal Code.

73.title: I don't wanna compare myself to Federer, Nadal, Djokovic: World no. 1 Alcaraz
73.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said it's "incredible" to be the youngest-ever world number one in men's tennis, but it's much tougher to stay on top for 20 years like the 'Big 3', Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic. "That's what I'm looking for. I don't wanna compare myself to them, but I wanna be like them," he added.

74.title: Jacqueline issued fresh summon in ₹200-crore money laundering case
74.article_body: Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing on Monday issued a fresh summon to actress Jacqueline Fernandez to appear before it on September 14 in connection with an alleged ₹200-crore money laundering case. Earlier, she had asked to skip the summons over prior work commitments. ED has named Jacqueline in their chargesheet in money laundering cases that involve conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar.

75.title: 4 farm labourers killed, 5 injured in lightning strikes in Gujarat
75.article_body: Lightning strikes killed four tribal farm labourers and injured at least five others in Gujarat's Surat, Dang and Dediyapada on Sunday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had forecasted heavy rainfall in some parts of the state till September 16. In one of the incidents, four people were returning home from the fields in Surat when they were struck by lightning.

76.title: Some things never change: Abhishek on surprising father Big B on set
76.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram and shared a picture of his surprise visit to his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's set. He also shared an old picture with his father. Along with the picture, Abhishek wrote, "Some things never change...Surprise visits to his set will always be one of my...favourite things to do."

77.title: Bombay HC orders probe against inspector who ensured minor's trial as adult
77.article_body: The Bombay HC has ordered a probe into allegations that a Mumbai Police inspector misled the Juvenile Justice Board to ensure a minor was tried as an adult. The minor, arrested in a murder case, was allegedly targeted as his father could not meet the officer's demand for ₹50,000. The boy had been lodged in the Thane Central Jail.

78.title: Baba Ramdev to launch IPO of 4 firms under Patanjali brand: Report
78.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev would launch the IPO of four companies under the Patanjali brand, a report said. The companies that'll be listed on the stock market during the next five years include Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. During an interview, Ramdev said that his company is planning to sell 6% promoters' stake in Patanjali Foods.

79.title: We've rejected Reliance Infra's ₹500-cr arbitration claim: Adani Transmission
79.article_body: Adani Transmission Ltd (ATL) on Monday said Reliance Infrastructure Ltd's ₹500-crore arbitration claim over a dispute under the share purchase agreement (SPA) in December 2021 has been rejected by it. These are afterthoughts and based on untenable positions, ATL said. It added that Reliance Infrastructure hasn't yet settled Adani Electricity Mumbai Ltd's significantly larger claims under the SPA.

80.title: NZ Rugby fined for not having 40% representation of women on board
80.article_body: New Zealand Rugby Chairman Stewart Mitchell has confirmed that the board has been penalised for not meeting Sport New Zealand's requirement for having a 40% representation of women on the board. According to a report, the country's apex body for rugby will lose $172,060 in funding from the government. Currently, three out of nine board members of NZR are female.

81.title: Woman arrested for stealing child from Mumbai to increase income
81.article_body: A 35-year-old Delhi woman was arrested for stealing the child of a Mumbai's Borivali-based couple in order to increase her source of income. Police say the couple had let the woman live with them for three days before she took off with the three-year-old boy. Police arrested the woman when she was trying to board a train from Dadar station.

82.title: Switzerland identifies site for nuclear waste storage facility
82.article_body: Switzerland's nuclear waste authority has identified a site for setting up the country's first permanent nuclear waste storage facility near the German border. The Swiss government, however, will need the parliament's approval before it can sign off on the proposed site. The proposal could also face a possible referendum. Construction of the storage facility is estimated to begin in 2045.

83.title: 4 coaches of passenger train derail in Odisha's Koraput; none hurt
83.article_body: At least four coaches of Visakhapatnam-Kirandul passenger special train derailed in Odisha's Koraput district on Monday, the East Coast Railway (ECoR) said in a statement. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far, officials said. "All passengers managed to get down safely from the train," Divisional Railway Manager Anup Satpathy said.

84.title: Sri Lanka showed true character as a unit to win Asia Cup 2022: Yuvraj
84.article_body: Congratulating Sri Lanka following their Asia Cup 2022 win, Yuvraj Singh said that they deserved to win the tournament. "After losing to Afghanistan in the first game [Sri Lanka] showed true character as a unit to win the tournament...well done skipper," he added. Sri Lanka won five matches in a row after losing to Afghanistan in their first match.

85.title: No reasons for Iran to reject EU's offer on nuclear deal: Germany
85.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Iran has no reason to reject the proposals by European countries on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal. It is regrettable that there has been no positive response to the proposal by Iran yet, Scholz added. Earlier this month, Iran sent its latest response to the EU's "final text" drafted for the pact's revival.

86.title: Pvt jets not allowed, world leaders to take bus to Queen's funeral in London: Report
86.article_body: World leaders and VIPs arriving in the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been asked to take commercial flights instead of private jets to transport them, Politico reported, citing a document. The attendees, including US President Joe Biden, can't take helicopters or state cars to the funeral, Politico said. They'll reportedly be taken to London's Westminster Abbey on a bus.

87.title: I feel proud we managed to create great energy at cinemas: Ayan on Brahmastra
87.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹225 crore worldwide within three days of its release, director Ayan Mukerji shared on Monday. "Brahmastra has gotten off to a great start with audiences over its first weekend," Ayan wrote, adding that he feels proud that the team "managed to create a great energy at...cinemas over the last three days".

88.title: Aaditya Thackeray could lose MCA membership for owing ₹7,941 in dues
88.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray and his cousin Varun Sardesai are among the 92 individuals who have defaulted on their annual membership fees of the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA), Kandivali. The MCA has written to the CEO asking for permission to cancel their memberships. Aaditya has a total outstanding of ₹7,941, while Sardesai's amount is pegged at ₹38,515.

89.title: Bodies of 3 teenage boys found from river after 3-day search in U'khand
89.article_body: The bodies of three boys, who were missing since September 10 in Uttarakhand's Pauri district, were found in a river on Monday. The boys, aged 13,15 and 16, had left their homes to stroll around the Duggada petrol pump area on a two-wheeler. The bodies were pulled out from the river with the help of ropes.

90.title: New sculptures installed in Pune to remain covered till inauguration: PCMC
90.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) installed sculptures across the city as part of a beautification process and they will remain covered till the inauguration, officials said. The project entails beautifying prominent chowks, and a team of artists from across the country was chosen to make sculptures using scrap material. Each sculpture will cost over ₹2 lakh, officials said.

91.title: BBMP begins demolition drive at 2 locations to clear stormwater drains
91.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started demolition drives at two locations in Bengaluru to clear stormwater drains following floods caused by heavy rains. While one BBMP team began demolitions in Mahadevapura zone, the other team started clearing parts of Ragam megastore in AECS Layout. BBMP Chief Engineer Basavaraj Kabade said, "20 buildings have encroached near Spice Garden Layout."

92.title: Does anyone want me to do it again?: Brie on playing 'Captain Marvel'
92.article_body: Actress Brie Larson, during D23 Expo, was asked how long she would play 'Captain Marvel' in MCU films. To this, she replied, "Does anyone want me to do it again? I...don't know. I don't have the answer to that." Brie first played the role in the 2019 film 'Captain Marvel'. She will next feature as Captain Marvel in 'The Marvels'.

93.title: 5 youths held for performing bike stunts in Chennai after video goes viral
93.article_body: Five bikers have been arrested for allegedly performing stunts on their bikes on Chennai road. A video showing the youths performing the stunts had gone viral. Twitter users had also tagged Chennai police and had called for action against the bikers. While two people were arrested on Saturday, police arrested three more accused on Sunday.

94.title: A weekend full of light: Alia as Brahmastra earns ₹225 cr worldwide in 3 days
94.article_body: As the worldwide box-office collection of 'Brahmastra' crossed ₹225 crore, Alia Bhatt took to Instagram on Monday to share a post thanking her fans. "A weekend full of light and our hearts full of love. So grateful for our audience," she wrote. The film was released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam on September 9.

95.title: Divorced man kidnaps girl to raise her as his child in Delhi; held
95.article_body: Delhi Police have rescued a four-year-old girl within 24 hours after she was kidnapped by a divorced man. The accused has been arrested and sent to judicial custody. "[He] is a divorcee and a drunkard. He wanted to raise the girl child as his own...But he got scared and had abandoned her on the way," a senior police official said.

96.title: 240 held for harassing women during Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad
96.article_body: Hyderabad's SHE Team arrested 240 people for allegedly misbehaving with women during the recently concluded festival of Ganesh Chaturthi. The arrested were found to be touching women inappropriately, stalking them, and taking their pictures near Ganesh pandals across the city. SHE Team members were clad in plain clothes and were secretly carrying cameras.

97.title: Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' sold for ₹125 cr to OTT platform: Report
97.article_body: The 'Ponniyin Selvan' franchise has reportedly been sold for ₹125 crore to an OTT platform. Filmmaker Mani Ratnam is the director of the two-film franchise. The first instalment of 'Ponniyin Selvan' will release on September 30. The film will feature Vikram, Karthi, Trisha Krishnan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

98.title: Pakistan played well in Asia Cup, but not very well: Inzamam
98.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that Pakistan played "well" in the recently-concluded Asia Cup tournament, but not "very well". "Many of their (Pakistan) flaws were on show. They could not capitalize on the pressure, which helped them reduce Sri Lanka for 58-5 at one stage of the game," Inzamam said. He added that the Lankan pacers had done their "homework".

99.title: Ethereum blockchain may be upgraded this week to cut energy use by 99.9%: Report
99.article_body: Ethereum blockchain is expected to undergo a software upgrade this week to allow it to consume 99.95% lesser energy than it currently does to create ether tokens, Reuters reported. The Ethereum Foundation said the upgrade, known as 'The Merge', will take place between September 10-20. The upgrade may widen the technology's use and support ether token's price.

100.title: Someone in your office ate your dosa: Cong to Tejasvi Surya
100.article_body: Responding to BJP leader Tejasvi Surya's comment that he didn't receive the parcel of dosas sent by Congress, party leader Tejesh Kumar C said that someone in Surya's office ate his dosas. "It's been more than 24 hours & I still haven't received it. They can't deliver a dosa properly and they dream of delivering good governance!" Surya previously said.

101.title: 40-yr-old man stabs 25-yr-old woman for abusing his mother in Delhi
101.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed by her 40-year-old neighbour in Delhi's Sagarpur for abusing his mother, officials said on Monday. The accused was under the influence of alcohol during the altercation, said DCP (southwest) Manoj C said. The accused alleged the woman had abused his mother, which angered him, he said, adding that he used a kitchen knife.

102.title: School bus with students catches fire in Navi Mumbai, no casualty
102.article_body: A school bus carrying students caught fire in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar area on Monday, officials said, adding that no injuries were reported. Four students of a school, a staffer and a driver were present in the vehicle when it caught fire, a fire official said. The fire was doused within 15 minutes, the official added.

103.title: There's wave of happiness: UP Deputy CM as Gyanvapi suit held maintainable
103.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak said there is a wave of happiness after the Varanasi district court held that a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque was maintainable. "I'm receiving many phone calls expressing happiness," Pathak said. The Anjuman Committee had said that the Gyanvapi mosque is a Waqf property.

104.title: Pregnant woman carried on stretcher, delivers baby in forest in Maha
104.article_body: A pregnant tribal woman was carried on a makeshift stretcher due to lack of a proper road in a village in Maharashtra's Palghar district, officials said on Monday. The 21-year-old woman delivered the baby in a dense and dark forest in Maharashtra. A video of the woman being carried by some people surfaced on social media.

105.title: Tyres stolen from 3 cars in Delhi's Greater Kailash, probe on
105.article_body: Thieves in Delhi's Greater Kailash area stole tyres from at least three cars in the early hours of Monday, the police said, adding that the accused took all four tyres of one car. CCTV footage of the incident shows a man getting out of a car around 3 am, quickly removing tyres and then escaping.

106.title: Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa announced
106.article_body: The BCCI has announced Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa. Fast bowler Mohammad Shami, who has been named standby player for India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, features in squads for both series. Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Hardik Pandya have been included in squad for Australia T20Is, while they have been rested for South Africa T20Is.

107.title: Retail inflation rises to 7% in August after falling for 3 straight months
107.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), rose to 7% in the month of August after falling for three straight months, government data showed. The CPI stood at 6.71% in July, 7.01% in June and 7.04% in May. In April, the CPI had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

108.title: Man stabs 2 brothers over argument about a girl in Delhi, 1 dead
108.article_body: A 20-year-old man was declared dead, while his 21-year-old brother sustained injuries after their friend stabbed them over an argument about a girl in Delhi, officials said on Monday. The accused was in a relationship with the woman in question, said DCP (north) Sagar Singh Kalsi, adding that the victims had passed comments about her a few days back.

109.title: I will feature in season 2 of 'Duranga': Actor Amit Sadh
109.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has revealed that he will be featuring in the next season of 'Duranga'. "I am happy to see the outpouring of love for my cameo role in Duranga. I have huge admiration for the whole team...especially the cast who have worked so hard to make a complex series," he stated. Gulshan Devaiah featured in the first season.

110.title: UAE court rejects Danish extradition plea for fraud case accused
110.article_body: An Emirati court has ruled that the prime suspect in a $1.7 billion tax fraud case cannot be extradited to Denmark. Sanjay Shah is wanted by Danish authorities for his alleged involvement in one of Denmark's largest-ever fraud cases. The case pertains to an elaborate scheme as part of which ineligible foreign businesses claimed tax refunds from the Danish exchequer.

111.title: Vedanta picks Gujarat for its $20-bn joint venture with Foxconn: Report
111.article_body: Vedanta has picked Gujarat to set up a semiconductor plant under its $20-billion joint venture with Taiwan's Foxconn, Reuters reported. Vedanta reportedly obtained financial and non-financial subsidies, including cheap electricity, from Gujarat to build the semiconductor plants. Vedanta had sought 1,000 acres of land free-of-cost on a 99-year lease while lobbying for incentives with states.

112.title: Muslim petitioners to move HC in Gyanvapi case as Hindu suit held maintainable
112.article_body: After Varanasi district court agreed to hear Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside Gyanvapi mosque, Muslim petitioners said they'll move to the High Court. Uttar Pradesh Minority Minister Danish Azad Ansari said the court verdict should be respected. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of Hindu side's plea, saying the mosque was a Waqf property.

113.title: Ex-Gazprom unit to pay penalty for failed LNG deliveries to India: Official
113.article_body: A former unit of Russia's Gazprom will pay a penalty for the LNG cargoes it failed to deliver to India since early June, said an official. Under a 20-year contract, Gazprom Marketing and Trading Singapore was to supply 2.5 million tonnes of LNG to GAIL (India) this year and will now pay a penalty of 20% of the agreed price.

114.title: These 2 weeks have been incredible: Alcaraz on 1st Grand Slam win, no. 1 spot
114.article_body: After winning his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and becoming the youngest men's world number one, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz tweeted, "These two weeks have been incredible and have included some very tough matches." He added, "Thank you NYC for the support...energy on court is impossible to explain! And thank you everyone on the other side of the world."

115.title: Article 370 will be restored in J&K: Mufti on Azad's can't be restored remark
115.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday responded to Ghulam Nabi Azad's "Article 370 cannot be restored" remark and said that it was his "personal opinion". "There are voices in J&K who believe Article 370 will be reinstated," she said. Congress is making false promises if they're talking about restoring Article 370, Azad previously said.

116.title: Man allegedly rapes dancer on pretext of taking audition in Gurugram
116.article_body: A man allegedly raped a 37-year-old professional dancer on the pretext of taking a dance audition in Gurugram. The woman alleged that he also filmed the act and had physical relations with her several times. "He threatened to kill me when I resisted...After...long time, I decided to move to police," she added. Police have registered a case into the matter.

117.title: Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
117.article_body: The BCCI today announced the 15-member Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Rohit Sharma will be captaining India in a major ICC tournament for the first time. The squad includes Harshal Patel, who will be featuring in his maiden T20 World Cup. Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who wasn't selected for last year's T20 World Cup, features in the squad.

118.title: Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal to tie the knot on October 6 in Mumbai: Report
118.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are reportedly getting married on October 6 in Mumbai. According to Pinkvilla, the pre-wedding festivities will begin at Delhi Gymkhana Club on September 30 and continue for three days. Mehendi and sangeet ceremony will take place on October 1. Reportedly, a reception will be held on October 7 at a Mumbai hotel for Bollywood celebrities.

119.title: 20 antique idols seized from French national's residence in Tamil Nadu
119.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Idol Wing CID seized 20 idols from the residence of a French national in Auroville city. An attempt to smuggle antique artefacts out of the country was planned before the officials raided the accused's residence. The search was initiated following information about a handicrafts shop illegally dealing in stolen antique artefacts belonging to Tamil Nadu.

120.title: External Affairs Minister signs condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II
120.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar signed the condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II at British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis's residence on Monday. "She will be long remembered as a friend and well-wisher of India," Jaishankar said. She was the longest-serving monarch of the United Kingdom and the second longest in world history.

121.title: Bank watchman steals guard's ATM card in Pune, escapes with ₹90,000
121.article_body: A watchman employed at Bank of Baroda's Kalewadi branch allegedly stole the ATM card of a 76-year-old security guard and withdrew ₹90,000 without his consent. The victim used to take the accused's help in withdrawing money, for which he shared his card details with him. The accused swiped the card at different ATMs, the investigating officer said.

122.title: Inventor behind Amazon's Alexa raises $20 mn for new AI startup
122.article_body: The inventor of various technologies used by Amazon Inc's Alexa, William Tunstall-Pedoe, has raised $20 million for a new Artificial Intelligence (AI) startup called Unlikely AI. Amadeus Capital Partners, Octopus Ventures and former Google CFO Patrick Pichette, who is currently a Twitter board member, are backing the startup. Tunstall-Pedoe left Amazon in 2016 and was advising AI companies.

123.title: Their ecosystem burnt alive 59 karsevaks in Godhra: Surya on Congress' post
123.article_body: Reacting to Congress' burning khaki shorts post, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised the party and claimed that Congress' ecosystem burnt alive 59 karsevaks in Godhra in 2002. "Congress' fires lit in the past have burnt them in most of India. The remaining embers in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh will also be reduced to ashes very soon," said Surya.

124.title: $7.75 million payment to whistleblower didn't breach deal with Musk: Twitter
124.article_body: Responding to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has said that the $7.75 million payment made to a whistleblower didn't breach any conditions of its $44 billion buyout agreement with Musk. Musk’s lawyers had earlier said that Twitter's failure to seek Musk’s consent for Peiter Zatko's payment violated the merger agreement, thereby stating it as another reason to end the deal.

125.title: $85 mn round fell apart at final moment: CEO of Pak-based startup that shut down
125.article_body: Pakistan-based e-commerce startup Airlift collapsed in July after an $85 million funding round "fell apart at the final moment", CEO Usman Gul told Bloomberg. This was Pakistan's largest-ever funding round at a record valuation of $275 million. A lead investor pulled its commitment, leaving Airlift with no capital to continue and forcing it to abruptly shut down, Gul said.

126.title: BMC introduces 'Bluetooth enabled' stethoscopes in 2 Mumbai hospitals
126.article_body: The BMC, with the help of a start-up, has introduced 'Bluetooth enabled' stethoscopes in two civic-run major hospitals, Sion and BYL Nair Hospitals. The digital stethoscope, AyuSynk, will detect remote auscultation (listening to chest sounds). This will allow doctors to maintain a safe distance in the case of infectious diseases, said Dr Neelam Andrade, the director of major civic hospitals.

127.title: Centre, states trying to control lumpy skin disease in cattle: PM
127.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said the Centre, along with state governments, is trying hard to control the lumpy skin disease (LSD) in cattle. He noted "there has been a loss of livestock due to the disease across many states in India". Thousands of cattle have reportedly died due to the disease in over eight states, including Gujarat and Haryana.

128.title: TMC MP's relative reaches ED office at 12:30 am after 'typo', pic surfaces
128.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee's sister-in-law, Maneka Gambhir, reached the Enforcement Directorate office at 12:30 am on Monday. A picture of her standing outside the locked office surfaced online. The central agency called the notice a 'typographical error'. A fresh notice for 12:30 pm was issued, after which she appeared before the agency on Monday afternoon.

129.title: Sanjay Dutt charges ₹10 crore for his next film with Vijay: Report
129.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt is reportedly charging ₹10 crore for an upcoming action thriller film which will also feature Vijay. The 63-year-old actor will be seen in a negative role in the upcoming project, according to the report. The yet-untitled film will reportedly be directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, who also helmed Kamal Haasan-starrer action film 'Vikram'.

130.title: Hostel warden arrested for sexually harassing 7 minor boys in Hyd
130.article_body: A 35-year-old warden was arrested on Sunday in Hyderabad, after as many as seven students alleged that he touched them inappropriately, officials said on Monday. According to reports, the accused forced the students to watch pornographic content on his phone. Furthermore, the accused used to abuse children who slept alone by touching them and sleeping beside them.

131.title: Congratulations for your 1st Grand Slam, no. 1 spot: Nadal to Alcaraz
131.article_body: Rafael Nadal congratulated fellow Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz for his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and the world number one ranking, saying it's the "culmination of your first great season". Nadal tweeted, "Great effort Casper Ruud...Tough luck today but amazing tournament and season!" The 19-year-old Spaniard beat Norwegian Ruud 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3 in the final.

132.title: Had Bhanuka scored at slower pace, his 71 would’ve been of no use: Inzamam
132.article_body: Talking about the importance of strike rate in T20s, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said that had Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa scored at a slower pace against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 final, then their total would've been around 140 runs. "So, [those 71] runs would've been of no use," he added. Bhanuka smashed 71*(45), helping Sri Lanka post 170/6.

133.title: No alliance with any topiwalla: Gujarat BTP leader Vasava
133.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) founder Chhotubhai Vasava said that his party won't have an association with any topiwalla, be it the ones wearing saffron caps or those donning white caps with a broom symbol. "All parties have ignored the issues of tribals," he added. Notably, BTP has been in an alliance with Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) since May.

134.title: Take back power reforms for the sake of poor people: KCR to Centre
134.article_body: Telangana CM KCR expressed disappointment over the Electricity (Amendment) Bill, 2022 and urged the Centre to take back the reforms. "You made three wrong laws against farmers, you took them back and apologised...So before people raise their voices again, I request you to take back reforms you have introduced for the sake of our poor and SC/ST people," said KCR.

135.title: Ram Temple's construction cost ₹1800 cr, space for seers to be made: Trust
135.article_body: An estimated cost of ₹1,800 crore will be incurred to build the Ram temple in Ayodhya, officials of the trust said. The general secretary of the trust said that the trust has also decided to make space for idols of prominent Hindu seers and the main characters from the Ramayana period in the temple complex.

136.title: Govt may invite EoIs for Container Corp of India's sale in Q3 FY23: Report
136.article_body: Centre may invite expressions of interest (EoIs) for strategic sale of Container Corporation of India (CONCOR) in Q3 FY23, CNBC TV18 reported. The Cabinet had approved the divestment of Centre's 30.8% stake in CONCOR, which is currently owned by Indian Railways, in November 2019. This comes after Indian Railways' land license fees was cut from 6% to 1.5%.

137.title: Adani Realty in advanced talks with DB Realty for merger deal: Report
137.article_body: Adani Realty is in advanced talks with Mumbai-based DB Realty for a merger deal, according to reports. The merger could be one of India's largest real-estate deals. The merger would reportedly aid Adani Realty in becoming a listed firm. Adani is likely to infuse more funds into DB Realty, which would result into a fresh equity issuance to new investors.

138.title: How much prize money did the Asia Cup 2022 winners and runners-up get?
138.article_body: Sri Lanka, who won the Asia Cup for the sixth time, received a total prize money of $150,000. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who finished runners-up at Asia Cup 2022, won a prize money of $75,000. Further, Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga, who was named Player of the Asia Cup 2022, received $15,000 for the award.

139.title: I’ve never let his image be heavy on me: Sunny on Dharmendra
139.article_body: Bollywood actor Sunny Deol, son of veteran actor Dharmendra, said he has never let his father's image be heavy on him. Sunny, who made his debut with 'Betaab' in 1983, said he knew he had to pave a path of his own. On the work front, Sunny will be next seen in R Balki's 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'.

140.title: Woman loses control of scooter, dies after falling in drain in B'luru
140.article_body: A 23-year-old woman died after she lost control of her scooter and fell into a drain in Bengaluru on Sunday. The accident took place at Banaswadi when the woman from Nepal was travelling with a male friend to Hennur at around 12.30 am. She was taken to a hospital where doctors declared her brought dead.

141.title: Missing student's body found with throat slit in West Bengal, friend held
141.article_body: The body of a 19-year-old missing engineering student has been found with the throat slit in West Bengal's Illambazar. The victim went missing on Saturday and his father received a ransom call for ₹30 lakh. The accused, who was friends with the victim, required money and made the latter consume liquor before killing him and making the ransom call.

142.title: Asia Cup win will help T20 WC 2022 preparation: Sri Lanka captain Shanaka
142.article_body: Following Sri Lanka's Asia Cup title, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said winning the tournament will help the team's preparation for the T20 World Cup, beginning next month. Sri Lanka beat Pakistan by 23 runs to win their sixth Asia Cup title. Sri Lanka will begin their T20 World Cup campaign with a qualifying match against Namibia on October 16.

143.title: Mumbai taxi, auto drivers to go on indefinite strike from Thursday
143.article_body: Over 48,000 taxi drivers and two lakh autorickshaw drivers in Mumbai, will go on an indefinite strike from September 15, Thursday, seeking a hike in fares, the drivers' union said. "Our demand is to increase the minimum taxi fare to ₹35 from the existing ₹25," said AL Quadros, General Secretary of Mumbai Taximen's Union.

144.title: German minister rejects Ukraine's demands to send main battle tanks
144.article_body: German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht has again rejected Ukraine's demand to send main battle tanks to support its troops amid the war with Russia. "No country has delivered Western-built infantry fighting vehicles or main battle tanks so far," she said. She added that Germany agrees with its partners that it will not take such action unilaterally.

145.title: Hope to constantly surprise: Kingsley on playing Trevor in 'Wonder Man'
145.article_body: Actor Ben Kingsley, who is reprising his role of Trevor Slattery in the upcoming Marvel Cinematic Universe series 'Wonder Man', said he hopes to "constantly surprise and refresh" as an artiste. The series will focus on the Marvel character Simon Williams, who plays the titular role. Ben had previously played Trevor in 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings'.

146.title: Indian players are picking injuries outside field, no one is addressing that: Sehwag
146.article_body: Referring to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's injury, Virender Sehwag said Indian players are getting injured outside the field and no one is addressing the issue. "[This] means the things that are happening outside or in the gym need to be addressed," added Sehwag. "Once you're in the Indian team...gym is not as important as skills," he further said.

147.title: India's milk production growth 3-times higher than global average: PM
147.article_body: Addressing the inauguration event of International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit, PM Narendra Modi said that the country's annual milk production growth is three times higher than the global average. "India produced 146 million tonnes of milk in 2014. It has now increased to 210 million tonnes. That is, an increase of about 44 per cent," he said.

148.title: Guj auto driver invites Kejriwal to dinner, he says 'Will you come to pick me up at hotel?'
148.article_body: An autorickshaw driver, Vikram Dantani, on Monday invited AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal for dinner at his home during AAP's town hall meeting with autorickshaw drivers before state polls. The Delhi CM said, "Will you come to pick me up at my hotel in your autorickshaw?" Kejriwal added he would come to dinner with two other AAP leaders at 8 pm.

149.title: This is new for me: Brendan on receiving award at Toronto Film Festival
149.article_body: Actor Brendan Fraser teared up after receiving the TIFF Tribute award for his performance in 'The Whale'. "This is new for me. I am normally the guy at the podium who hands these things out, I got pretty good at it," he stated. Earlier, Brendan received a standing ovation at the Venice International Film Festival for 'The Whale'.

150.title: Take down picture immediately: Patra on Congress' burning khaki shorts post
150.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and asked the party to take down the burning khaki shorts post immediately from social media. "It's not 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' but 'Bharat Todo' and 'Aag Lagao Yatra'...I want to ask Rahul Gandhi if he wants violence in this country. Congress should take down the picture immediately," said Patra.

151.title: B'luru civic body launches Wonder on Wheels for Anganwadi children
151.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Monday launched the 'Wonder on Wheels' initiative to introduce art and cultural activities for Anganwadi children in the city. The bus will travel across Bengaluru and stop by Anganwadis. Children will be engaged for one hour in activities related to theatre, music, art and culture.

152.title: Take steps to curb the spread of lumpy skin disease: Shinde to officials
152.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asked the state's Animal Husbandry Department officials to be on alert and take steps to curb the spread of lumpy skin disease. He also instructed officials to run an awareness campaign to fight the disease. Earlier last week, the government had declared the state as a "controlled area" to curb the spread of the skin disease.

153.title: King Charles exempted from paying inheritance tax on Queen Elizabeth's personal assets
153.article_body: Queen Elizabeth is estimated to have left behind over $500 million in personal assets from her 70 years on the throne. While the bulk of the late Queen's personal wealth will pass to King Charles, he won’t be required to pay any inheritance tax as a rule introduced by the UK government in 1993, exempts sovereign-to-sovereign bequests from inheritance tax.

154.title: Kriti Sanon starts to prepare for Anurag Kashyap's next film: Reports
154.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has reportedly started preparing for director Anurag Kashyap's upcoming action drama. As per reports, she is undergoing acting workshops and language coaching for the film, which is her first project with Kashyap. "It's an extremely emotional film and the vengeance unleashed by Kriti's character is like never seen before on screen," the reports stated.

155.title: 6 girls escape from hostel in Mumbai by breaking window, locking guard
155.article_body: Six minor girls escaped from the Government Girls Hostel located in Mumbai's Govandi area by allegedly breaking cement window of the toilet and bending the iron grill fixed outside it. The minor girls reportedly locked the gate of the guard's room from outside before fleeing so they don't get followed. The police have been able to identify all the girls.

156.title: 16 women employees faint after spraying of mosquito repellent in Greater Noida firm
156.article_body: At least 16 women employees working in an electronic parts manufacturing company in Greater Noida fell unconscious after a mosquito repellent was sprayed in the company. The management later admitted the unconscious women to a private hospital. The relatives of the women, who reached the hospital, created a ruckus and filed a complaint, accusing the company's management of the incident.

157.title: Haryana women's panel head asks policewoman to get out during meet, video viral
157.article_body: The chairperson of Haryana State Commission for Women, Renu Bhatia, asked a woman police officer to "get out" of a room during a discussion over a marital dispute case, reports said. A video of the incident has gone viral. Bhatia is seen asking the woman police officer, "You could have slapped him (man)...You got the girl checked (medically) thrice."

158.title: No preconditions for mending ties with Saudi Arabia: Iran
158.article_body: Iran has no prerequisites in its talks with Saudi Arabia for normalisation of ties between the two countries, the Iranian Foreign Ministry said on Sunday. "Iran will respond proportionately to any constructive action by Saudi Arabia," the ministry's spokesperson said. Saudi Arabia severed diplomatic relations with Iran in 2016 after a violent mob broke into the Saudi embassy in Tehran.

159.title: Russian and French Presidents hold talks on security at Zaporizhzhia
159.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and French President Emmanuel Macron held talks over the safety issue at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Putin blamed Ukrainian forces for the shelling while Macron pointed finger at Russian troops. Russia called for a "non-politicised interaction" with UN nuclear watchdog IAEA's participation. France said Russian troops were putting the plant at risk.

160.title: Good toss to lose boys: Jayawardena after SL's win over Pak in Asia Cup final
160.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said it was a "good toss to lose" after the Dasun Shanaka-led side defeated Pakistan while batting first in the Asia Cup 2022 final. Prior to the final, Sri Lanka had won matches in the tournament in which they won the toss and fielded first. Sri Lanka defended their 170/6 and won by 23 runs.

161.title: Iran to release 2 seized Greek tankers' crew: Greek seafarers union
161.article_body: The Greek union of commercial ships' seafarers has said that Iran has agreed to release the crew of two Greek tankers that were seized by it in May. Iran had seized the tankers after the US confiscated Iranian oil from a tanker, due to sanctions, held off the Greek coast. The union said that the crew would be replaced.

162.title: Neeraj Kabi to portray Jawaharlal Nehru in Vicky's 'Sam Bahadur': Report
162.article_body: Actor Neeraj Kabi has reportedly been roped in to portray India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru in 'Sam Bahadur', an upcoming film starring Vicky Kaushal, Sanya Malhotra and Fatima Sana Shaikh. Vicky will play the role of Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in the movie. While Sanya will essay the role of Manekshaw's wife Silloo, Fatima will portray former PM Indira Gandhi.

163.title: Parts of Pune recorded 60 mm rainfall in 2 hours on Sunday: Report
163.article_body: Pune city witnessed heavy rainfall along with thunder and lightning on Sunday. In less than two hours, many areas in the city, including Wanowrie and Magarpatta, reportedly saw over 60 mm of rainfall. The city reported waterlogging in 25 areas and two incidents of wall collapse from Bavdhan and Warje. Uprooting of 10 trees was also reported in some places.

164.title: Warner is a tactical captain, someone guys love playing under: Finch
164.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has suggested that David Warner could be their next ODI captain. "Warner is an unbelievable tactical captain and someone who at the time the guys loved playing under," stated Finch. Notably, Warner was banned from leadership roles over his involvement in the 2018 sandpaper scandal. "I think (Cricket Australia) is revisiting that," added Finch.

165.title: BJP is worried as public is going to repeat Cong in Rajasthan: CM Gehlot
165.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that "BJP leaders are worried because the mood of the public is to repeat" the Congress government in the state. "There are excellent schemes in Rajasthan including [the] Chiranjeevi health insurance scheme...BJP leaders are working on a theory that if a lie is spoken 100 times, then it will appear as truth," CM Gehlot said.

166.title: No republic plan for New Zealand after Queen's death: PM Ardern
166.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said her government is not considering changing the country to a republic after the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Ardern said she thought New Zealand would probably become a republic during her lifetime but there were more pressing issues. Earlier, Ardern expressed her support for New Zealand to eventually become a republic.

167.title: Sachin Shroff replaces Shailesh Lodha in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'
167.article_body: Actor Sachin Shroff has replaced Shailesh Lodha to play the titular role in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "We had tried a lot to find a middle ground but [Shailesh] left the show...We've a team of good writers and direction...so hopefully people will accept Sachin in the role of Taarak Mehta," the show's producer Asit Kumarr Modi told Aaj Tak.

168.title: Went to washroom, media said I was unhappy: Ajit on leaving during NCP meet
168.article_body: While talking about reports of him leaving the stage during the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) meet in Delhi, party leader Ajit Pawar said that he had just gone to the washroom. "It was presented in the media as if I am unhappy," Pawar said, adding, "Should I give it in writing on a stamp paper that I am not unhappy?"

169.title: I'm super grateful to Ekta Kapoor: Pratik Sehajpal on bagging Naagin 6
169.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Pratik Sehajpal penned a note on Instagram thanking producer Ekta Kapoor for giving him his first-ever television show 'Naagin 6'. Calling himself "an outsider with no industry background", he said that he is "genuinely super grateful" to Ekta. "God bless you infinitely...Thank you for everything!" Pratik further wrote.

170.title: 12-yr-old girl raped in farmhouse near Pune, 22-yr-old man arrested
170.article_body: A 12-year-old girl living in employee quarters at a farmhouse located near Pune was allegedly raped by his 22-year-old neighbour. The man is related to the family of the girl and has been arrested. The girl was alone at her home when the man raped her and threatened to harm her family members if she informed anyone, police said.

171.title: Subject, content of Akshay Kumar's recent films were wrong: Theatre owner
171.article_body: Manoj Desai, executive director of Gaiety Galaxy and Maratha Mandir Cinema, opened up about actor Akshay Kumar's recent films failing at the box office. "Content galat, subject galat (Wrong content, wrong subject)," Desai stated. He added that people were not satisfied with the content of 'Raksha Bandhan'. Akshay's 'Prithviraj', 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Raksha Bandhan' failed to perform this year.

172.title: Krejcikova-Siniakova win US Open title, complete career Golden Slam
172.article_body: Czech duo of Katerina Siniakova and Barbora Krejcikova defeated all-American duo of Caty McNally and Taylor Townsend 3-6, 7-5, 6-1 to win their third Grand Slam doubles title of the year at US Open 2022 on Sunday. With this, the Tokyo Olympics gold medallists completed their career Golden Slam. Overall, it was the Czech pair's sixth Grand Slam title together.

173.title: SEBI seeks startup valuation details from PE and VC funds: Report
173.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), on September 6, sent a communication to private equity (PE) and venture capitalist (VC) firms to check how they value the startups they support, the Economic Times reported. The SEBI asked firms to disclose qualifications of valuation agent. Investor complaints on opaque accounting practices may have triggered communication, the report said.

174.title: Tom Hanks is the greatest living actor: 'Pinocchio' director
174.article_body: 'Pinocchio' director Robert Zemeckis called Tom Hanks "the greatest living actor in the movie business". He said he enjoyed watching Tom bring his character of Geppetto to life. He said Tom's portrayal of the role was "spot on, wonderful and very warm". "Tom can do anything. He brought more to the role than I ever could have imagined," he added.

175.title: Illegal call centre busted by Gurugram Police; 4 arrested
