175.article_body: Four people, including a woman, were arrested by the Gurugram Police for being involved in a loan app fraud racket. The suspects had set up an illegal call centre to extort money from victims and used to threaten them to reveal their liabilities, police said. The suspects were identified as Deepak, Sakshi Mehta, Ankit Kumar and Divyansh Kumar.

176.title: Yohani makes B'wood debut, sings 'Manike Mage Hithe' for 'Thank God'
176.article_body: Music composer Tanishk Bagchi has launched Sri Lankan singer Yohani of 'Manike Mage Hithe' fame in Bollywood with Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God'. She has sung the song in Hindi for the film, which also stars Sidharth Malhotra. "We knew this song, so we decided to use it. Bringing it into a Bollywood film would also help [Yohani]," Tanishk said.

177.title: Arjun Kapoor, Bhumi head to London for Mudassar Aziz film: Reports
177.article_body: Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar have left for London to reportedly start shooting for Mudassar Aziz's untitled directorial, which is said to be a comedy film. As per reports, the team will shoot for a month in London. Reportedly, after shooting a portion of the film with Arjun and Bhumi, the makers will finalise the film's second female lead.

178.title: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro to attend Queen's funeral
178.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has accepted an invitation to attend the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II, the country's foreign ministry said. The ministry told Reuters that Bolsonaro will travel to London on September 19. Other world leaders who are expected to attend the funeral include US President Joe Biden, UK Prime Minister Liz Truss and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

179.title: Which 7 Bollywood movies have entered ₹100-crore club in 3 days?
179.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra' has become the seventh Bollywood movie to earn ₹100 crore in three days of its release, collecting around ₹105 crore in the opening weekend. Other Bollywood movies to do so are 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' (₹101.5 crore), 'Sultan' (₹105.6 crore), 'Dangal' (₹104.6 crore), 'Tiger Zinda Hai' (₹115 crore), 'Race 3' (₹100.75 crore) and 'Sanju' (₹119.35 crore).

180.title: Won't collect wet garbage from societies with over 100 kg waste: PCMC
180.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has said that it will not collect wet garbage from housing societies that generate more than 100 kg of waste daily from October 2. The housing societies will have to dispose of their bulk wet waste on their own. The civic body collects more than 850 metric tonnes of garbage every day.

181.title: Woman seen punching dog, slamming it on road 5 times in Agra; incident caught on CCTV
181.article_body: Agra Police has launched an investigation after a CCTV footage showing a woman beating up a dog was widely circulated online. She can be seen slamming the dog on the ground five times after holding it by its leash. The dog is said to be in critical condition after the incident, according to reports.

182.title: Noida woman who slapped society guard arrested, later gets bail
182.article_body: A woman was arrested and then later granted bail after she was caught on video repeatedly slapping a security guard of a housing society in Noida, police said. "According to what we've learnt, [the woman] was angry because the guard didn't open the gate quick enough when she was entering...colony," an SHO said. The woman is reportedly a professor.

183.title: Often struggle finding my footing in Bollywood: Sayani Gupta
183.article_body: Actress Sayani Gupta said she "often struggles finding" her footing in Bollywood, and in such times, she looks up to her brother Probir Gupta as an inspiration. "My brother is a stalwart in the art world and he's one of the biggest reasons I do what I do," she said as she shared some of his latest work on Instagram.

184.title: 100% of animals will be vaccinated against brucellosis by 2025: PM Modi
184.article_body: Talking about problems related to lumpy skin disease, PM Narendra Modi assured that 100 per cent of animals would be vaccinated against Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD) and brucellosis in the country by 2025. "Our scientists have prepared an indigenous vaccine for lumpy skin disease. We are also emphasising on universal vaccination of animals," said the PM.

185.title: Footwear collected during immersion procession fills 6 tempos: PMC
185.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has said that footwear collected by its Solid Waste Management Department during the last day of the Ganpati immersion procession on September 9 filled six tempos. The department also collected 33 tonnes of garbage, including 21 tonnes of nirmalya (floral offerings to Ganpati). Around 0.5 million people took part in the procession on Friday and Saturday.

186.title: Israeli PM Lapid visits Germany to hold talks on Iran nuclear deal
186.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid will meet German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, President Frank-Walter Steinmeier and Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock in Berlin. Lapid aims to persuade Western powers to stop trying to revive Iran nuclear deal. Before arriving in Berlin, Lapid thanked the UK, France and Germany for their "strong position" as they raised concerns over Iran's commitment to revive the deal.

187.title: A list we mustn't be left out of: Mahindra on 'top 10 most educated countries' list
187.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Monday reacted to a list shared on Twitter which showed the 'top 10 most educated countries' in the world. "This is a list we must not be left out of," Mahindra tweeted, as India was not included in the list. He further wrote, "It's not just the government's task. We all have to do our bit."

188.title: Antigua and Barbuda to hold referendum for Republic as Charles becomes King
188.article_body: Antigua and Barbuda plans to hold a referendum on becoming a Republic in a move that could see King Charles III removed as the head of state. "This is a matter that has to be taken to a referendum...within the next, probably, three years," PM Gaston Browne said after Charles was confirmed as the country's King following Queen Elizabeth's death.

189.title: SC dismisses man's plea to exhume body of son killed in J&K encounter
189.article_body: Supreme Court dismissed the plea of a man to hand over the body of his son Amir Latief Magrey who was killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Hyderpora. Administration submitted that the deceased was buried in compliance with Islamic last rites. Court allowed the family to offer prayers at the grave and directed state to comply compensation order.

190.title: UP court rules in favour of Hindu women’s petition in Gyanvapi mosque case
190.article_body: Varanasi District and Sessions Court has dismissed the challenge by Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee against the maintainability of civil suits challenging the title of the Gyanvapi mosque and the land surrounding it. Five Hindu women had filed petitions seeking the right to worship Maa Shringar Gauri on the outer wall of the mosque complex located next to Kashi Vishwanath temple.

191.title: 3 villas lying vacant due to floods in B'luru looted; jewellery stolen
191.article_body: Thieves looted diamond, gold and silver jewellery from three villas in Bengaluru's Rainbow Drive layout after their residents had moved out due to flooding in the city. Residents realised they'd been looted when they returned to their homes to asses the flooding situation. One of the residents reportedly lost five pieces of diamond jewellery and 22 pieces of gold jewellery.

192.title: St Stephen's can't conduct interviews for non-Christians: Delhi HC
192.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday said that admission of students from non-minority communities for undergraduate courses at St Stephen's College will take place completely on the basis of Common University Entrance Test (CUET) score. The court further ruled that no interviews would be conducted for admissions of non-Christian students and ordered the college to withdraw the admission prospectus.

193.title: Women real leaders of India's dairy sector, represent 70% of workforce: PM
193.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has stated that women are the real leaders of India's dairy sector, adding that they represent 70% of the workforce. He was speaking at the inauguration of the International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit 2022. "In 2014, India produced 146 million tonnes of milk. Now it has increased to 210 million tonnes," he said.

194.title: Stray fireworks explode at festival in Mexico; 1 dead, 39 injured
194.article_body: One person died and 39 others were injured after stray fireworks exploded during a town festival in Mexico's Tianguistenco. The municipal government said that of those injured, five were in serious condition and seven are still hospitalised. A video of the incident purportedly shows a firework-laden "torito", a wood or wire framework, running through the crowd, The Associated Press reported.

195.title: I would've bowled out Haris after SL lost 5 wickets: Latif on Babar's captaincy
195.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif has questioned Babar Azam's captaincy against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup 2022 final, stating that he would've kept attacking using Haris Rauf's overs after Sri Lanka lost five wickets for 58 runs. "Instead, Babar bowled part-time spinner. That surprised me...No wickets fell [till the 15th over] and run-rate also kept climbing," added Latif.

196.title: Didn't receive masala dosa parcel sent by Congress: Tejasvi Surya
196.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised Congress and claimed that he did not receive the masala dosa parcel that was sent by the Congress. Earlier on Saturday, the Congress workers said that they were sending 10 different dosas from popular restaurants to Surya. This comes after he was seen reviewing masala dosa when people of Bengaluru were affected by the floods.

197.title: Ganesh laddu auctioned for ₹60.8 lakh through crowdfunding in Hyd
197.article_body: A Ganesh laddu weighing five kilograms was auctioned for ₹60.8 lakh through a crowdfunding initiative in Keerthi Richmond Villas in Hyderabad's Sun City. A Keerthi Richmond Villas trustee said that the auction was part of an annual fundraiser by RV DIYA Charitable Trust for the benefit of maids, drivers, gardeners and labourers around the gated community, Times of India reported.

198.title: Couple celebrating 60th anniversary opened card signed by Queen Elizabeth the day she died
198.article_body: An elderly couple from UK opened a hand-signed card from Queen Elizabeth II, congratulating them on their 60th wedding anniversary, on the day she died. The couple received the card on September 7 but waited until the next day to open it on their anniversary. The couple learned of the Queen's illness while they were out on a celebratory lunch.

199.title: GHMC to create advertising space near transformers to generate revenue
199.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) plans to enhance the vicinity of 1,000 transformers in each of the six zones of the city and then allow private agencies to give it as advertisement space. "We are inviting proposals from private players for the enhancement of the area surrounding the transformers," a GHMC official told The New Indian Express.

200.title: IMD issues orange alert for 2 days amid heavy rainfall in Pune
200.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Pune and adjoining areas on Sunday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall in Ghat areas over the next two days, an official said. Meanwhile, several incidents of trees falling were reported from Pune and adjoining areas.

201.title: Video shows Punjab woman struggling to stand on road due to 'drugs'; probe launched
201.article_body: Police in Punjab's Amritsar launched an investigation after a video of a woman struggling to stand on road allegedly under influence of drugs surfaced online. "A video showing a girl under the influence of drugs went viral yesterday. However, no drug or syringe was found with her...Amritsar Police conducted a search operation and took 15 suspects into custody," police said.

202.title: 19-year-old beaten to death for stealing mobile phone in Delhi
202.article_body: A group of factory workers allegedly killed a 19-year-old by beating him with belts and plastic pipes after catching him stealing a mobile phone in Delhi. The victim's hair was also chopped off by the main accused to teach him a lesson, police said. His body was found lying on a road in Shahzada Bagh with chopped hair strewn around.

203.title: Ahmedabad Police deny conducting raids at Aam Aadmi Party's district office
203.article_body: Ahmedabad Police took to Twitter to say no raids were carried out at the district office of the Aam Aadmi Party. This comes after Gujarat AAP leader Isudan Gadhvi said that raids were carried out at the office. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal also reacted to it and said that BJP is "extremely rattled" by support AAP is getting in Gujarat.

204.title: Delhi Metro's Yellow line affected for 3 hours over technical snag
204.article_body: The Yellow line of Delhi Metro, which connects Huda City Centre to Samaypur Badli, was affected for roughly three hours over technical snag on Monday. The entry gate of MG Road station was also suspended temporarily but the exit was operational. DMRC (Delhi Metro Rail Corporation) carried out pre-planned maintenance work between Sultanpur and Qutab Minar metro stations on Sunday.

205.title: Video shows doctor abandoning car in Bengaluru traffic & running 3 km to perform surgery
205.article_body: A video showing a gastroenterology surgeon, Dr Govind Nandakumar, running to a hospital in Bengaluru to perform an emergency surgery after his car got stuck in the traffic has gone viral online. According to reports, Dr Nandakumar ran for three kilometres and later performed a successful laparoscopic gallbladder surgery on a woman patient. The incident took place on August 30.

206.title: Nitish Kumar and Lalu Yadav will be meeting Sonia Gandhi soon: Tejashwi
206.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav confirmed that CM Nitish Kumar and RJD supremo Lalu Yadav will be meeting UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi in the backdrop of Opposition’s attempts at forging an alliance against the BJP. Bihar CM was recently seen meeting Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav during his visit to Delhi.

207.title: Man poses as London surgeon, cheats woman of ₹8.2 lakh for Rakhi gift
207.article_body: A Mumbai woman has been cheated out of over ₹8.2 lakh after a fraudster posing as a surgeon from London promised her a gift for Rakshabandhan. The two met on Instagram and began chatting as brother and sister when the man promised her a gift. The accused asked her to pay customs clearance, conveyance charges and insurance on separate occasions.

208.title: We're for it: Sri Lanka Prez on Bill to decriminalise homosexuality
208.article_body: Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sunday said that the country's government will not oppose a Private Member's Bill to decriminalise homosexuality, the Colombo Gazette reported. "We are for it, but you have to get the support of individual members. It's a matter of their private conscience," he said. The Bill was handed over to Wickremesinghe in August.

209.title: WazirX says bank accounts worth ₹65 crore frozen by ED released after probe
209.article_body: WazirX said on Monday that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has released bank accounts frozen as part of its investigation into money laundering. The crypto exchange platform said it can now resume banking operations after over a month. In August, the ED had frozen WazirX's bank assets worth ₹64.67 crore for "assisting accused instant loan app companies in laundering fraud money".

210.title: Boys damaged Marine Lines foot overbridge: BMC's bridge dept to vigilance
210.article_body: The vigilance department under the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) conducted a probe to check the recently-built Marine Lines foot overbridge after receiving several complaints from commuters and found broken and popped-up tiles in the bridge. However, the bridge department refuted the allegations by vigilance and claimed that boys might have broken the tiles with cricket bats.

211.title: I am devastated that my time at Chelsea has come to an end: Thomas Tuchel
211.article_body: Thomas Tuchel has said he's devastated that his time at Chelsea as manager came to an end last week. "This is one of the most difficult statements I have ever had to write...This is a club where I felt at home, both professionally and personally," wrote Tuchel on Twitter. Graham Potter has been named as the new manager.

212.title: Bengaluru action plan committee formed to revive its lost glory: Congress
212.article_body: Owing to the recent flooding incidents in Bengaluru, the Congress has formed a committee to restore the city's lost glory. "Under the chairmanship of Ramalinga Reddy, I have formed an action plan committee. We will formulate a plan based on the committee's report that will help in reclaiming Namma Bengaluru's lost glory," said Congress leader DK Shivakumar.

213.title: Biden to widen curbs on exporting US chips, tools to China: Report
213.article_body: The Biden administration plans to widen curbs on shipment of US-made semiconductors to China used for artificial intelligence and chipmaking tools, sources told Reuters. The Commerce Department is looking to publish new rules communicated to three US firms in letters written earlier this year. The letters barred the firms from exporting chipmaking equipment to Chinese factories without licences.

214.title: Sonali Phogat's death to be probed by CBI: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
214.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said that his government will hand over the case pertaining to the death of Haryana BJP leader and actor Sonali Phogat to the CBI. "We have full faith in our police but people have repeatedly demanded and her daughter has also demanded that the case be handled by the CBI," he said.

215.title: Have seen ‘Vikram Vedha’, actors did tremendous job: Rakesh Roshan
215.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said he watched 'Vikram Vedha' and found the script was "intelligently presented" by Pushkar-Gayatri. He said the filmmakers presented the plot in a novel way and the actors "have done a tremendous job". 'Vikram Vedha', which is the Hindi remake of the Tamil film with the same name, stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan as leads.

216.title: PM Modi likely to flag off Vande Bharat Express on 30th September
216.article_body: PM Modi is likely to flag off Vande Bharat Express from Gandhinagar on 30th September. The train conducted successful trial between Ahmedabad and Mumbai on Friday. "Railway is planning to start Vande Bharat Express between two financial hubs of the country from 30th September, however, final decision will be taken after confirmation from the PMO," said a source.

217.title: Ukraine says Russia attacking civilian infrastructure in retaliation
217.article_body: Ukraine accused Russia of targeting civilian infrastructure after its troops launched an offensive to drive out Russian forces from Kharkiv. According to Ukrainian officials, water facilities and a thermal power station were attacked in Kharkiv which led to widespread blackouts. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said winter could see further territorial gains if Kyiv received more powerful weapons.

218.title: World's largest shipping firm reroutes fleet to avoid clashes with Sri Lankan blue whales
218.article_body: The world's largest shipping and logistics company, MSC Group, has rerouted its ships passing near the coast of Sri Lanka in order to avoid potential collisions with endangered blue whales. MSC said that the action came in response to research conducted by the International Fund for Animal Welfare along with other organisations. MSC's voluntary rerouting doesn't impact other shipping carriers.

219.title: Harry Styles wins his first acting honour at Toronto Film Fest
219.article_body: Singer-actor Harry Styles, who attended the Toronto Film Festival 2022 with his 'My Policeman' co-stars Emma Corrin and David Dawson, won his first acting award at the festival's Tribute Awards. The cast of 'My Policeman' received the ensemble award on Sunday night. Thanking the audience for the award, Harry said he and his cast members loved working on the film.

220.title: Prashant Kishor is a businessman: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh
220.article_body: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh criticised political strategist Prashant Kishor and called him a businessman. “Has PK ever seen Bihar? PK embodies different roles. Right now PK is working for the BJP. The education system has improved so much and so much work has been done for the girls...We all know whose work they are doing,” said Singh.

221.title: Offer is still open: Gulshan on starring with Kartik in 'Aashiqui 3'
221.article_body: Gulshan Devaiah had recently expressed his will to be Kartik Aaryan's "leading lady" in 'Aashiqui 3'. He said that while the tweet was a joke, the "offer is still open" and he will "definitely consider" playing the part as it will be a "tough thing to pull off". "If I pull it off convincingly, it will be awesome," he said.

222.title: Germany calls for more support for Ukraine's counteroffensive
222.article_body: German politicians have called for active promotion of counteroffensive in Ukraine with new weapons after its troops succeeded in driving Russian forces out of some parts of the country. Michael Roth from Social Democratic Party of Germany said it seems realistic "that Ukraine can win this war...as a...democratic country". Germany supplied heavy weapons to Ukraine like Panzerhaubitze 2000.

223.title: Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya & her husband Vishagan welcome baby boy
223.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya Rajinikanth and her husband Vishagan welcomed a baby boy on Sunday. "With God's abundant grace and our parents' blessings, Vishagan, Ved and I are thrilled to welcome Ved's little brother Veer Rajinikanth Vanangamudi," Soundarya tweeted. She also shared pictures from her pregnancy shoot on Twitter.

224.title: PM Modi inaugurates World Dairy Summit in Greater Noida
224.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit 2022 in Greater Noida today. Around 1,500 participants from 50 countries are expected to participate in the four-day summit being organised at India Expo Centre and Mart. "India is building the largest database of dairy animals," PM Modi said during the inauguration ceremony.

225.title: Sonu Sood announces free online IAS coaching program
225.article_body: Actor and philanthropist Sonu Sood's Sood Charity Foundation, in collaboration with Divine India Youth Association (DIYA), announced the launch of free online IAS coaching program, called Sambhavam, for the year 2022-23. "The goal is to provide equal opportunities to IAS aspirants from all economic backgrounds and empower them with knowledge. Knowledge is power after all," Sonu said.

226.title: We’re living in times when language is no more a barrier: Ranveer
226.article_body: At the recently held South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA) 2022, Ranveer Singh hailed India's diversity and expressed how language is no more a barrier. The actor said he's grateful that people are rising above subtitles and are accepting "stories from different languages and cultures". Ranveer won the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India at the event.

227.title: Jacqueline's questioning in Sukesh case postponed over prior commitments
227.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who was summoned by Delhi Police for questioning in connection with the conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar case, asked to skip the summons over "prior work commitments". Her request has been granted and Delhi Police will be issuing fresh summons to the actress at a later date. Jacqueline was earlier questioned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED).

228.title: SL Navy detains 85 people trying to illegally migrate by boat
228.article_body: Sri Lanka Navy has detained 85 people who were allegedly attempting to illegally migrate to a foreign country by a boat in the eastern waters on Sunday, local media reported. The detained people include 60 men, 14 women and 11 children. Five suspects linked to the illegal migration attempt were also arrested following a search operation at a beach.

229.title: Jaishankar meets Saudi Crown Prince, gives him PM Modi's written message
229.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah on Sunday and handed over a written message from PM Narendra Modi. Jaishankar arrived in Saudi Arabia on Saturday on a three-day visit to discuss ways to further strengthen relations between the two countries. It is his first visit to Saudi Arabia as External Affairs Minister.

230.title: This is the best feeling: Ranbir on success of 'Brahmastra'
230.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, along with director Ayan Mukerji, visited a theatre in Mumbai to witness the audience's reaction to 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva'. As the duo greeted fans after the show, Ranbir expressed how it's been "the best feeling" to watch the audience being entertained and emotional during the film. Ranbir said he is "extremely happy and proud" of Ayan.

231.title: Khap Mahapanchayat seeks CBI probe in Phogat's death, threatens mass agitation
231.article_body: A Haryana Khap Mahapanchayat held in Jat Dharamshala has asked the state government to recommend a CBI probe in actress-BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death case by September 23. The Mahapanchayat has threatened to launch a mass agitation if the CBI probe is not recommended. Phogat's daughter Yashodhara was also a part of the meeting held on Sunday.

232.title: Electric mobility startup Yulu raises $82 million in funding
232.article_body: Electric mobility startup Yulu has raised $82 million in a Series B funding round led by Canada-based mobility technology firm Magna International. Existing investors, including Bajaj Auto, also participated in the current round. The startup was founded in 2017 by Amit Gupta, RK Misra, Naveen Dachuri and Hemant Gupta, three of whom graduated from IIT Kanpur.

233.title: Govt is result of organisation's hard work, it's bigger than govt: UP BJP chief
233.article_body: UP BJP chief Bhupendra Singh Chaudhary said government is a result of organisation's hard work, hence organisation is bigger than government. "There is no question about it," Chaudhary added. "When public gave us the opportunity, we worked to fulfil that agenda decided by the party. The government is taking ahead that agenda of the party," he stated.

234.title: Pune faces power cuts after heavy rain, bikes float on waterlogged road; video surfaces
234.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Pune on Sunday, flooding streets and causing power cuts in several areas, reports said. A Twitter user shared a video of bikes floating in water on a waterlogged road. Parts of Pune received 50 mm rain in nearly an hour on Sunday evening. Several instances of trees falling were also reported in the city and adjoining areas.

235.title: Prince William sent last-minute text to Harry inviting him & Meghan to Windsor: Report
235.article_body: Prince William reportedly sent a last-minute text to Prince Harry inviting him with his wife Meghan Markle to Windsor Castle to pay tributes to the late Queen Elizabeth. According to a royal source, "The Prince of Wales thought it was an important show of unity at a...difficult time." Their walkabout was delayed by 45 minutes as they discussed their plans.

236.title: Easy to comment from outside: Coach Saqlain on criticism of Rizwan's batting
236.article_body: Reacting to former cricketers', including Shoaib Akhtar's, criticism of Muhammad Rizwan's batting in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said, "Easy to comment from outside, one gets to know only when they are part of the team." Shoaib had tweeted, "Rizwan, 50 off 50 is not going to work anymore. Doesn't benefit Pakistan."

237.title: Rachakonda police rescue motorist who fell into flowing water
237.article_body: Rachakonda Traffic Police has saved the life of a 30-year-old man who slipped and fell with his bike into flowing water at Kolanupaka Culvert causeway with the help of L&O police and villagers, police said. The police also shared a video of the incident on Twitter. Rachakonda CP Mahesh Bhagwat has also announced a reward for the traffic police.

238.title: BMC to start door-to-door BP, diabetes screening of people above 30 years
238.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation will conduct a door-to-door screening of people above 30 years for blood pressure and diabetes in order to identify and treat the conditions early. Additional Municipal Commissioner Dr Sanjeev Kumar said that 68% of people aged between 18-69 years die of non-communicable diseases like heart attacks, kidney diseases, strokes and cardiovascular complications.

239.title: Delhi Police uses Pak cricketers' clip from Asia Cup in road safety tweet
239.article_body: Delhi Police has used a clip of Pakistani cricketers Asif Ali and Shadab Khan bumping into each other while trying to take a catch in the Asia Cup final for a road safety tweet. The clip had the song 'Aye Bhai Zara Dekh Ke Chalo' playing in the background. Both fielders dropped the catch in the match against Sri Lanka.

240.title: Multiple layers of protection keeps your privacy protected: WhatsApp
240.article_body: WhatsApp introduces new built-in privacy features of protection like online presence, leave groups silently, screenshot blocking for view once. These multiple new features along with existing features like end-to-end encryption, two-step verification, and encrypted backups come together to offer users more control over their privacy needs, said the brand.

241.title: Mysterious sea creature like 'blue goo' found in Caribbean; pic goes viral
241.article_body: A mysterious sea creature, which the scientists referred to as 'blue goo', was found on the floor of the Caribbean Sea by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Okeanos Explorer crew. "Seen multiple times during off St Croix, this "blue goo" animal stumped scientists, who thought it might be soft coral, sponge, or tunicate," the crew tweeted.

242.title: Was following official orders: Principal on video of students cleaning toilets
242.article_body: The Ballia primary school principal, who was suspended over purportedly making students clean school toilets, has said that he was only following official orders. He said it was part of a cleanliness drive by teachers and students for the Swachhata Pakhwada programme. "I received an order from the Block Education Officer...I also cleaned toilets with the students," he added.

243.title: Tesla sees three more executives depart months after India plan put on hold: Report
243.article_body: Tesla has seen three of its executives from the original 12-member India team depart in the last three months, Economic Times reported. The exits come after its Policy and Business Development executive Manuj Khurana resigned in June. While earlier reports said Tesla has put its India plan on hold, the company is yet to to give up its Bengaluru office.

244.title: 'Secret' letter by Queen Elizabeth locked in Australia vault, can't be opened till 2085
244.article_body: A 'secret' letter written by Queen Elizabeth II in 1986 is locked inside a vault in a historic building in Australia, reports said. Addressed to the Lord Mayor of Sydney, an instruction reads, "On a suitable day...in the year 2085 AD, would you please open this envelope and convey to the citizens of Sydney my message to them."

245.title: Heavy rains lash parts of Pune, water enters houses; video surfaces
245.article_body: Several areas in Pune were waterlogged after heavy rainfall lashed the city on Saturday. Several roads, including the one outside the Pune Fire Brigade office on BT Kavade road, were submerged in water and rainwater also entered the houses of some people in the Kothrud area of Pune. The city received 70 mm of rainfall until 6:45 pm on Saturday.

246.title: Lucknow minor who staged his own kidnapping recovered from Delhi
246.article_body: A 15-year-old boy from Lucknow who staged his own kidnapping has been recovered from Delhi, counselled and handed over to his parents. The boy had been angry with his family members over some issue and faked the kidnapping, police said. His phone was operational and he kept sending voice messages in his own voice but made no ransom calls.

247.title: Thousands protest against planned European LGBTQ event in Serbia
247.article_body: Thousands of religious and right-wing groups marched through Serbia's Belgrade in a protest against a European LGBTQ event which is scheduled to take place this week. The country's President Aleksandar Vucic had announced his decision to cancel the event in August, however, the event's organisers had said they will hold the event even if authorities cancel it.

248.title: Gautam Gambhir poses with Sri Lankan flag after Asia Cup final, shares video
248.article_body: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir took to social media to share a video of him posing with Sri Lankan flag after Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by 23 runs in the final in Dubai to win Asia Cup 2022. "Superstar team...Truly deserving!!" Gambhir wrote. Sri Lanka won the Asia Cup for the sixth time.

249.title: Gujarat AAP leader claims police raided party office in Ahmedabad
249.article_body: Gujarat AAP leader Isudan Gadhvi on Monday claimed that after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal arrived in Ahmedabad, the police raided the party's district office. Kejriwal reacted to the alleged raid by saying that BJP is "extremely rattled" by the support that AAP is getting in Gujarat. "Nothing was found in Delhi and nothing was found in Gujarat too," Kejriwal added.

250.title: Doctor examines woman under torch after long power cut in UP, video surfaces
250.article_body: A doctor in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia allegedly examined a woman under torch light after a long power cut. A video of the incident also surfaced online. A doctor said the hospital has a generator for power backup but it took time as batteries for the generator were being found. The batteries had been removed due to fear of being stolen.

251.title: Ex-Lido staff gets threat calls, texts from parents as firm files for bankruptcy
251.article_body: Several former sales executives at Lido Learning received calls, messages, and even threats from parents after the company filed for bankruptcy. One of the messages read, "We're...going to the police against you and your fraud company." In February, Lido asked over 1,200 employees to resign and most executives claim they’re yet to recover their own dues from the company.

252.title: Don't want to cash in on franchise's popularity: Anees on No Entry 2
252.article_body: Speaking about 'No Entry Mein Entry', filmmaker Anees Bazmee stated that he doesn't want to cash in on the popularity of the franchise by making something mediocre. The filmmaker further said that the film will continue from where the 2005 prequel 'No Entry' ended with Salman Khan, Fardeen Khan and Anil Kapoor. The film is expected to roll in January.

253.title: Carlos has sort of mixture of both Nadal and Djokovic: Casper Ruud
253.article_body: After losing to Spain's Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open final, Norway's 23-year-old Casper Ruud said Alcaraz has a "sort of mixture of both" Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic's qualities. "Alcaraz is fast, flexible. He can slide around. It's impressive...he's a hard nut to crack," added Ruud. Alcaraz won the final to become the youngest men's world number one.

254.title: Last ball 6 helped us with momentum & it's a game of momentum: SL's Bhanuka
254.article_body: Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa, who slammed 71*(45) against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 final, has said the last over of their innings helped them to get the momentum in the game. "This is a game of momentum," added Bhanuka. Sri Lanka scored 15 runs off the final over, with Bhanuka smashing a six off the final delivery.

255.title: 7 die, 3 injured as bus they were travelling in hits trailer in Chhattisgarh
255.article_body: Seven people were killed and three others were injured after the bus that they were travelling in rammed into a parked trailer near Madai Ghat in Korba district. News agency ANI reported that the incident took place around 4 am on Monday. Police officer Santosh Singh said that those injured have been admitted to a hospital.

256.title: Ramiz Raja asks 'Aap India se hain?', grabs Indian reporter's phone after Pak's defeat
256.article_body: After Pakistan lost the Asia Cup final, a video of PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja getting angry at an Indian journalist and grabbing his phone went viral. The video shows the journalist asking, "People are very sad. What message would you give them?" Getting angry at this, Raja said, "Aap India se honge? Aap to bade khush honge?"

257.title: Couldn't get night show tickets for 'Brahmāstra', watched morning show: Hansal
257.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta has said that he failed to get night show tickets for Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra', adding that he went to the "nearly 60-70%" full cinema hall for the morning show. "I really enjoyed #Brahmastra...And long queues for the later shows at the same multiplex. The 2nd part is going to be HUGE," the filmmaker tweeted.

258.title: Audience's love is the biggest 'Brahmāstra' for us: Ranbir Kapoor
258.article_body: Speaking about the success of his film 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor said that the love they are receiving is the biggest 'Brahmāstra'. "People are laughing, clapping. This is what [cinema] is all about," the actor added. 'Brahmāstra' earned ₹75 crore on its opening day and ₹85 crore on the second day, making the film's total worldwide collection ₹160 crore.

259.title: I’m a Champion, but also a SleepyCat: Ruturaj Gaikwad in SleepyCat ad
259.article_body: SleepyCat announced that as India's highest-rated mattress brand, it has launched its latest campaign 'Champions Are Also SleepyCats', with cricket champions Ruturaj Gaikwad and Harleen Deol. The campaign films aim to show how they prioritise their rest along with their intense training regimens on their SleepyCat Ultima Mattress. It's India's first mattress with CoolTEC™ Fabric, SleepyCat added.

260.title: Violence erupts in MP Ganesha procession as woman asks to turn music off
260.article_body: Violence erupted in Madhya Pradesh's Udaipura over music being played during a Ganesha immersion procession. Police said that the incident took place when a woman belonging to another community reportedly objected to youths dancing in the procession and asked them to turn the music off. The woman allegedly also threw water on people from the roof of her house.

261.title: Tata Group makes offer to buy stake in Bisleri International: Report
261.article_body: The Tata Group has reportedly made an offer for a stake in India's largest packaged water company Bisleri International. A report, while citing an executive, stated that the stake would allow Tatas a "massive foothold in packaged drinking water" in various categories across different levels. Notably, Bisleri has more than 150 manufacturing plants with a network of over 4,000 distributors.

262.title: BEST to start premium bus service between Thane and BKC from Sept 26
262.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) will start its premium services between Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) and Thane from September 26. "The buses will operate during peak hours on office-going routes. The seats can be booked through the Chalo app and no standees will be allowed," a BEST official said. BEST has placed an order for procuring 200 buses.

263.title: India reports 5,221 new COVID-19 cases and 15 deaths, positivity rate at 2.82%
263.article_body: India has reported 5,221 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours and 15 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,076 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country stood at 47,176, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.82%.

264.title: PM Modi to visit Noida today, traffic police issues advisory
264.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Noida today to inaugurate International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit which is being organised at India Expo Centre and Mart, Greater Noida. In view of the PM's visit, Noida Traffic Police issued an advisory for daily commuters to avoid disruption in movement. The police have placed various diversions on the Delhi-Greater Noida Expressway route.

265.title: Shadab Khan apologises after Pakistan lose Asia Cup final, says 'I take responsibility'
265.article_body: After his team lost Asia Cup 2022 final against Sri Lanka by 23 runs, Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan tweeted, "Catches win matches. Sorry...I take responsibility for this loss. I let my team down." Shadab dropped Bhanuka Rajapaksa in 18th over. He was also involved in a collision with Asif Ali, which led to another dropped catch in the 19th over.

266.title: Ups and downs will be there, but it'd be nicer if we make lesser mistakes: Babar
266.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said it would've been nicer had they made lesser mistakes against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup 2022 final. "In a final, the margin for mistakes is lesser. Our fielding wasn't up to the mark...the batting couldn't finish it off well," he added. Sri Lanka bundled out Pakistan for 147 to win by 23 runs.

267.title: Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is actually 'Gandhi family bachao yatra': BJP MLA
267.article_body: Assam BJP MLA Diganta Kalita said that Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is actually "Gandhi family bachao yatra". "Even after 75 years of independence...the Congress party did not think about others who can lead the party apart from the Gandhi family," Kalita added. "The Congress party has now become only Gandhi party and a circus party," he stated.

268.title: False: PVR CEO on report claiming 'Brahmastra' caused ₹800-crore loss to cinema chains
268.article_body: Reacting to a report which alleged that Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' caused theatre chains PVR and INOX cumulatively to lose over ₹800 crore in market capitalisation on the release day, PVR CEO Kamal Gianchandani called it "false and negative" information. He tweeted, "Is it a lack of understanding or is it intentionally designed to cast doubts?"

269.title: Pak's Shadab jokingly tries to raise umpire's finger during Asia Cup final, video viral
269.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan jokingly tried to raise umpire's finger after a DRS decision went against Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2022 final against Sri Lanka. During the sixth over of Sri Lanka's innings, Pakistan called for review after umpire signalled not out for an LBW appeal. The decision stood after DRS showed 'umpire's call' for ball hitting the wickets.

270.title: NIA raids 50 locations in North India linked to organised terror gangs: Report
270.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Monday raided about 50 locations in North India linked to organised terror gangs involved in narco-terrorism, arms smuggling, inter-gang rivalry and other illegal activities, Hindustan Times reported. The NIA conducted searches in Delhi-NCR, Haryana and Punjab in connection with suspected terror gangs linked to Sidhu Moosewala's killing, ANI reported.

271.title: Drugs entering India via Gujarat port, smuggled to Punjab: Kejriwal
271.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said drugs are entering India in large quantities through Gujarat port and are being smuggled to Punjab and other parts of the country from there. "Why is this happening? Apparently, somewhere the administration is involved at the top," he added. Kejriwal did not mention the name of any particular port.

272.title: Delhi kidney racket accused inspired by 3 idiots, thinks he's gifted: Police
272.article_body: Delhi Police have said that the main accused in a kidney transplantation racket in South Delhi is inspired by the movie '3 Idiots'. "[He] thinks he is a gifted surgeon...He said doctors were only hired to do the side work. All surgeries were performed by him and he has a 100% success rate," a police source said.

273.title: Reliance Infra files ₹13,400 crore claim in 2017 deal with Adani Transmission
273.article_body: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Infrastructure has filed an arbitration claim of ₹13,400 crore against Adani Transmission, citing "breach of terms" in a deal to sell its Mumbai power distribution business. "The financial implication cannot be ascertained and is contingent upon the final outcome of arbitration," the company said. Notably, Adani acquired Reliance's power business for ₹18,800 crore in 2017.

274.title: Delhi civic body asks people to register pets amid rise in dog-bite cases
274.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Sunday asked residents to get their pets registered due to an "increasing number" of dog-bite incidents. The civic body added that it's mandatory to do so under Section 399 of Delhi Municipal Corporation Act 1957 and that the MCD can detain a dog found in a public place if the registration isn't done.

275.title: Getting to 170 made the difference mentally, as 160 feels chasable: Dasun
275.article_body: Talking about their 23-run win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2022 final, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said getting to 170 runs made the difference "mentally", as 160 feels chasable. "Each and every individual did well for us and that is how we became champions," he added. Sri Lanka were 58/5 after 8.5 overs but ended up posting 170/6.

276.title: Water supply to be hit in parts of Delhi on Sept 13-14
276.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board said that parts of national capital will face water supply disruptions in the evening of September 13 and the morning of September 14. The water supply will be affected due to maintenance work in the area. The list of affected areas include - North East Delhi, Sonia Vihar, Karawal Nagar, Tahirpur, Dilshad Garden and Nand Nagri.

277.title: Woman, brother-in-law arrested for husband's murder in Hyderabad
277.article_body: A woman, her brother-in-law and three others were arrested for allegedly murdering her husband, who'd been missing since August, in Hyderabad. The woman and her brother-in-law were apparently in a relationship and had plotted to kill the deceased. Reportedly, the deceased was given a drink laced with sedatives, was choked to death and his body was dumped in a river.

278.title: Late Sonali Phogat's last film 'Prerna' will be released soon: Film makers
278.article_body: Late BJP leader and actress Sonali Phogat's last film titled 'Prerna' will be released soon, said the makers of the movie on Monday. Director/Producer Naresh Dhanda, who plays the role of the father-in-law in the film, said that 'Prerna' is a motivational film. Sonali Phogat's daughter Yashodhara released the movie's poster on Friday.

279.title: Gadkari shares Akshay Kumar's ad on 6-airbags, Twitter users say 'ad promotes dowry'
279.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recently shared an ad on road safety and six airbags that featured actor Akshay Kumar. In the ad, Akshay taunts a father at a wedding for sending his daughter and son-in-law in a car with just two airbags. Commenting on it, Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi said that the ad promoted the "criminal act of dowry".

280.title: Teen killed boy in Nuh to evade studies, hoped it'd shut madarsa: Police
280.article_body: Days after a decomposed body of an 11-year-old boy was found in a mosque on the premises of a madrasa in Nuh, police have said that a teenager allegedly killed the victim as he did not want to study at the madrasa. The accused hoped that a "big incident" would lead to the madrasa being shut down.

281.title: How much prize money did US Open 2022 winners and runners-up get?
281.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Świątek bagged a prize money of $2.6 million (over ₹20 crore) each for winning men's and women's singles titles, respectively at US Open 2022. Casper Ruud and Ons Jabeur, who finished runners-up in their respective categories, won $1.3 million (over ₹10 crore) each. Alcaraz won his maiden Grand Slam title, while Świątek won her third.

282.title: Mount Mary fair begins in Bandra; festival to be live-streamed
282.article_body: The Mount Mary fair, also known as Bandra fair, commenced on Sunday after a gap of two-year due to COVID-19 pandemic. The festival will be live-streamed through social media handles and multiple LED screens have been placed outside the church so that the public can watch the religious ceremonies. The fair will reportedly have around 430 shops and food courts.

283.title: 19-year-old Alcaraz wins US Open 2022, becomes youngest men's world number one in history
283.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz defeated 23-year-old Casper Ruud of Norway in the final to win US Open 2022 men's singles title. It's Alcaraz's first-ever Grand Slam title victory. He won the final with scoreline of 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3. Alcaraz has become the youngest men's world number one in tennis history, breaking Lleyton Hewitt's record (20 years and 9 months).

284.title: Was exhausted & burned out: Amala on taking break from films in 2019
284.article_body: Actress Amala Paul, speaking about her break from films in 2019, said that she did not "quit" films as her films weren't doing well or she wasn't getting offers. "I got the biggest offers of my career at that point...I had to say no because I simply needed a break," she stated. "I was tired, exhausted, burned out," she added.

285.title: Delhi records 137 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths
285.article_body: Delhi reported 137 fresh cases of COVID-19 and two deaths due to the infection in the past 24 hours, the city health department informed on Sunday. With the new cases, the city's active caseload stood at 717. Moreover, as per health department data, the national capital's COVID-19 death toll climbed to 26,493.

286.title: I agree with his anger: Real Madrid manager on Asensio's outburst
286.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said he understands forward Marco Asensio's anger at not being brought in to play during their match against Mallorca. "I agree with him. It's normal, it means he wants to play...he has been the most affected," said Ancelotti. A video showing Asensio kicking and throwing bottles in the dugout during the match has gone viral.

287.title: Red Bull's Verstappen wins Italian GP, closes in on 2nd world title
287.article_body: Red Bull F1's Max Verstappen started seventh on the grid and went on to win the 2022 Italian GP to potentially be one win away from his second world championship. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc finished second, ahead of Mercedes' George Russell. Debutant Nyck de Vries scored his first points for Williams F1 in a race that ended behind the safety car.

288.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan to win their 6th Asia Cup, their first since 2014
288.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by 23 runs in the final in Dubai to win Asia Cup for the sixth time. Bhanuka Rajapaksa top-scored for Sri Lanka in the final with 71*(45), while Pramod Madushan took four wickets and Wanindu Hasaranga took three wickets. It's Sri Lanka's first Asia Cup victory since 2014, when also they defeated Pakistan in the final.

289.title: Make sure the engine is right: Leclerc fumes at Ferrari F1 engineer
289.article_body: Ferrari F1 driver Charles Leclerc gave an angry reaction after his race engineer told him to be careful about the way he was shifting gears during the 2022 Italian Grand Prix. "I can't guys...Make sure the engine is right," said Leclerc, who finished second despite being on pole. The race ended with Leclerc 116 points behind championship leader Max Verstappen.

290.title: People of J&K against terrorism, helping police: LG Manoj Sinha
290.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said that the Union Territory is witnessing a change, and people are against terrorism and helping the police deal with it. He added that after revoking Article 370 in 2019, the situation changed and the backbone of terrorism was broken. "Earlier, peace was purchased, now it is established," Sinha said.

291.title: Death toll from migrant boat capsize off Tunisia rises to 11
291.article_body: The death toll from a migrant boat capsize last week off the coast of Tunisia in the Mediterranean Sea has risen to 11, the Tunisian state media reported on Sunday. The boat was carrying 37 people, out of which 14 have been rescued so far. As many as 12 occupants of the boat are still missing.

292.title: UP CM Adityanath announces ₹50 lakh ex-gratia to families of martyrs
292.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced ex-gratia of ₹50 lakh to family members of Army Jawan Naik Suraj Pal and Navy Jawan Haresh Kumar Singh. Expressing grief, CM Adityanath said that the government stands with the families of the departed soldiers. A government job will also be provided to one member each from their families.

293.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrives in Edinburgh after 6-hour journey
293.article_body: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrived in Edinburgh on Sunday after a six-hour journey from Balmoral Castle, her summer home in the Scottish Highlands. The coffin will remain overnight at the Palace of Holyroodhouse, Elizabeth's official Scottish residence. It will be taken to Edinburgh's St Giles Cathedral for a service on Monday. The queen's state funeral will be held on September 19.

294.title: Novak Djokovic will be allowed to play 2023 Australian Open: Reports
294.article_body: Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic will reportedly be able to play the Australian Open in 2023 despite not taking his COVID-19 vaccination. Djokovic was deported from Australia earlier this year, ahead of the tournament and given a three-year travel ban. Australia's new immigration minister has reportedly agreed to remove Djokovic's ban and allow him to compete in the Grand Slam.

295.title: Krejcikova complains of smelling weed during US Open doubles match
295.article_body: Czech Republic tennis player Barbora Krejcikova complained to the chair umpire that she could smell weed being smoked in the stands during her women's doubles semifinal match in the US Open. The umpire then gestured towards the crowd to not smoke inside the stadium. Earlier in the tournament, during a men's singles match, Nick Kyrgios also had a similar complaint.

296.title: Italian govt, UAE firm pick up 44% stake in Titagarh Wagons' subsidiary Firema
296.article_body: The Italian government and a UAE-based private equity firm, Hawk Eye DMCC, have together picked up nearly 44% stake in Titagarh Wagons’ fully-owned subsidiary Firema SpA. The Italian government picked 30.30% stake for 10 million euros, while Hawk Eye picked 13.64% stake for 4.5 million euros. The remaining 5.5 million euros was infused by a Titagarh Group company.

297.title: 4 of 6 criminals who escaped from jail lynched by mob in Meghalaya
297.article_body: Four of the six undertrial prisoners, who escaped from a jail in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills on Saturday after overpowering prison guards, have allegedly been lynched by a mob in Shangpung village, Meghalaya DGP LR Bishnoi said. Bishnoi added that their bodies will be taken to hospital for identification. The mob had allegedly attacked the prisoners with rods and sticks.

298.title: You're a great champion: Lewandowski to fellow Pole Swiatek on her US Open win
298.article_body: Congratulating Iga Swiatek after she became the first-ever Polish woman to win the US Open, compatriot and Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski tweeted, "You're a great champion, and you've proven it yet again on the biggest stage." He added, "I am so happy for you!" World number one Swiatek defeated Ons Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5) in her maiden US Open final.

299.title: Saiyami, Gulshan Devaiah to star in a film produced by Anurag Kashyap
299.article_body: Actors Gulshan Devaiah and Saiyami Kher are teaming up for a film, which is being produced by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap. Speaking about reuniting with Gulshan after 'Unpaused Season 1', Saiyami said, "There is a comfort level working with him." She added that Gulshan is extremely creative and an amazing actor. The yet-untitled film is being shot in Hyderabad.

300.title: Govt planning to set up trade promotion body: Piyush Goyal
300.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has said the redesigning of the Commerce Department is under process. "We are in...process to redesign the structure of the Commerce Ministry and one of the ideas in front of us is to set up a 'trade promotion body'," he said. "[The]...body would be set up to devise an overall strategy to achieve targets," he added.

301.title: Steve Smith 'signals' free-hit after smashing six, video goes viral
301.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith smashed a six on bowling of New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham in the third ODI and immediately 'signalled' a free-hit. Smith made the free-hit gesture towards the umpires, indicating that the next ball should be a free hit as there were five fielders outside the 30-yard circle. "Steve Smith’s awareness is second to none," a commentator said.

302.title: Stuart Broad overtakes Glenn McGrath's tally of wickets in Test cricket
302.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad on Sunday became the second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket among fast bowlers. With his three-wicket haul in South Africa's second innings in the third Test, Broad took his tally of wickets in Test cricket to 566. He overtook former Australia fast bowler Glenn McGrath, who had taken 563 wickets in 124 Test matches.

303.title: Squid Game's Lee Jung-jae to star in 'Star Wars' series 'The Acolyte'
303.article_body: Lee Jung-jae, who starred in South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', has signed on to play the male lead in 'Star Wars' series 'The Acolyte'. Meanwhile, 'The Hunger Games' actress Amandla Stenberg has been roped in to play the female lead. 'The Acolyte' is set a century before the events of 'Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace'.

304.title: Will try to maintain communication despite Turkish Prez's remarks: Greece
304.article_body: Athens would try to keep communication channels with Ankara open despite Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's recent "unacceptable" comments, Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis said on Sunday. Erdogan had said that Turkey was ready to "do what is necessary" in the wake of the Greek "occupation" of demilitarised islands in the Aegean Sea. Notably, both Turkey and Greece are NATO members.

305.title: NASA shares pic of 9/11 terror attacks as captured from space
305.article_body: To commemorate 21st anniversary of 9/11 terror attacks, NASA took to Twitter to share a picture of the attacks as seen from International Space Station (ISS). NASA wrote, "On September 11, 2001...astronaut Frank Culbertson took this photo from...ISS of smoke rising from the Twin Towers in New York City." It added, "We honor the victims and heroes of the...attacks."

306.title: UAE's tourism revenues surpass $5 billion in first half of 2022
306.article_body: The tourism revenue of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) surpassed 19 billion dirhams (around $5 billion) in the first half of 2022, officials said on Sunday. "The total number of hotel guests reached 12 million, achieving 42% growth and we expect a strong tourism performance in this winter season," Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum said.

307.title: Minor girl gang-raped, set on fire in UP's Pilibhit district
307.article_body: A 16-year-old girl belonging to the Dalit community was allegedly gang-raped and set ablaze by two men in UP's Pilibhit district, police said on Saturday. The victim is undergoing treatment and is in a "serious condition", police added. The accused have been arrested and booked under the Indian Penal Code (IPC), the POCSO Act and the SC/ST Act, police informed.

308.title: Man Utd manager sets 20-goal target for Rashford for the season: Reports
308.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has reportedly set forward Marcus Rashford a 20-goal target for the ongoing 2022-23 season. "The manager wants Marcus to be United's number one striker and lead the line...Marcus is really happy," said a report. Rashford netted five goals last season but already has three goals and two assists in six matches this term.

309.title: What a knock: Akhtar on Rajapaksa's 71*(45) vs Pakistan in Asia Cup final
309.article_body: Praising Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa for his unbeaten half-century against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022 final, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar tweeted, "After 57/5, getting to 170 [is] what you call a great comeback. Rajapaksa, what a knock." Rajapaksa scored 71* off 45 deliveries. Sri Lanka put up a total of 170/6 in 20 overs.

310.title: Will gherao BJP lawmakers' homes over tea workers' demands: TMC's Abhishek
310.article_body: TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee on Sunday said houses of all BJP MPs and MLAs in West Bengal will be gheraoed if tea garden workers' demands aren't met by December. He demanded provident fund and gratuity benefits for over 3 lakh tea garden workers. "Though [PM] Narendra Modi was a tea seller, he did nothing for tea garden workers," he said.

311.title: Bhuvneshwar is world-class, I want to see his pace over 140 km/hr: Brett Lee
311.article_body: Calling India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar "world-class", Brett Lee said, "I want more from Bhuvneshwar because I know how good he is." He added, "I want to see Bhuvi continue to make sure he swings the ball both ways, keeps his pace over 140 km/hr, and if that happens, he leads from the front. He's a part of the wolf pack."

312.title: 1 dead, 40 injured after dam wall collapses at South African mine
312.article_body: At least one person was killed and 40 others were injured after a tailings dam wall collapsed at a dormant diamond mine in South Africa's Free State province on Sunday, provincial authorities said. The deluge of mud and water from the dam wall collapse swept away houses and cars. A pregnant woman is among those hospitalised, authorities informed.

313.title: Swiatek continues to get more and more confident in big moments: Annacone
313.article_body: Following Iga Swiatek's third Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, Roger Federer's former coach Paul Annacone said the world number one continues to get more and more confident in the big moments. "This is gonna be trouble for a lot of women on the women's tour," he added. The 21-year-old Pole has won two Grand Slams this year.

314.title: 1,200 gifts received by PM Modi to be auctioned from Sept 17 to Oct 2
314.article_body: Over 1,200 gift items received by PM Narendra Modi will be auctioned from September 17 to October 2 and the proceeds from it'll go to Namami Gange Mission. The auction will be conducted through the web portal, pmmementos.gov.in. The base price of the gifts ranges from ₹100 to ₹10 lakh and they are displayed at National Gallery of Modern Art.

315.title: Florence Pugh, Sebastian Stan to feature in Marvel's 'Thunderbolts'
315.article_body: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige has announced the cast of the upcoming film 'Thunderbolts' at the D23 Expo panel on Saturday. Actress Florence Pugh and actor Sebastian Stan are set to feature in the film. Actor David Harbour will also be a part of the film. Except for Pugh, the whole cast of the film was present at the event.

316.title: Being underdogs helped SL to play fearless brand of cricket in Asia Cup: Jaffer
316.article_body: Talking about Sri Lanka's performance after they reached Asia Cup 2022 final, Wasim Jaffer said Sri Lanka played brilliant cricket and peaked at the right time after losing their first match against Afghanistan. "Being underdogs in the tournament helped Sri Lanka to play a fearless brand of cricket," he added. Sri Lanka are on a four-match winning streak.

317.title: Govt sets petrol, diesel prices on basis of election dates: Cong
317.article_body: Alleging that the government reduces or freezes the petrol and diesel prices during elections, Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said, "Petrol and diesel prices are regulated by election dates and not global rates." He asked why citizens had to bear high fuel prices when crude oil prices were at a seven-month low. Vallabh added that consistently high retail inflation is concerning.

318.title: KRK deletes his 'vengeance' tweet, says 'I've forgotten whatever bad happened with me'
318.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan deleted his "I'm back for my vengeance" tweet which he had posted after being released from jail on bail. He later tweeted, "Media is creating new stories. I'm back and safe at my home. I don’t need any revenge from anyone. I've forgotten whatever bad thing happened with me. I believe...it was written in my destiny."

319.title: Felt something in my gut when I read 'Causeway' script: Lawrence
319.article_body: Actress Jennifer Lawrence said she felt something in her gut when she read the script of 'Causeway'. Speaking about the feeling, she said, "That kind of immediate, 'We have to make this'." Jennifer has acted and produced the film. "I identify with that feeling of trying to find your home...I left home when I was 14," she further stated.

320.title: Pakistan's Shadab, Asif collide while attempting catch, ball goes for a six; video viral
320.article_body: Pakistan's Shadab Khan and Asif Ali collided near the boundary while attempting a catch during their Asia Cup 2022 final against Sri Lanka. On the last delivery of Sri Lanka's 19th over, Bhanuka Rajapaksa lofted the ball towards deep mid-wicket, where both Asif and Shadab went for the catch. Asif mistakenly parried ball over for a six amid the collision.

321.title: Mahesh Babu, Jr NTR condole Krishnam Raju's demise
321.article_body: Celebrities including Mahesh Babu and Jr NTR took to Twitter to express grief over the demise of veteran actor and former Union Minister Krishnam Raju. "A very sad day for me," Mahesh wrote, adding that his life, work and immense contribution to cinema will always be remembered. "Deeply saddened...I extend my heartfelt condolences to his family," Jr NTR tweeted.

322.title: Fans wearing India jersey denied entry to Asia Cup final, Bharat Army shares video
322.article_body: Fans wearing India jersey were denied entry to the Dubai International Cricket Stadium for the Asia Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and Sri Lanka. The Bharat Army, the official Team India supporters group, shared a video to share their ordeal. "We were asked to go out. They even pushed us," a fan stated.

323.title: Organisers surprise Świątek by putting tiramisu inside her US Open trophy, video viral
323.article_body: US Open 2022 organisers surprised women's singles champion Iga Świątek by putting tiramisu inside her US Open trophy. A video of the same has gone viral. The organisers asked her to open up top of the trophy. Świątek then found out tiramisu was kept inside it. After winning the final, Świątek had said she'd celebrate with a lot of tiramisu.

324.title: Countrymade bombs explode during BJP's rally in Bengal; 2 injured
324.article_body: Several country made bombs allegedly exploded during a protest rally organised by the BJP in Sitalkuchi area of West Bengal's Cooch Behar district. As per reports, at least two BJP workers, who sustained injuries in the incident, have been admitted to a district hospital. Following the incident, a police team was reportedly deployed to bring the situation under control.

325.title: It annoyed me: Dogecoin co-creator on Musk sending Doge-1 to the Moon
325.article_body: Dogecoin co-creator Jackson Palmer said he was "kind of annoyed" when billionaire Elon Musk attempted to send a crypto-themed satellite called Doge 1 "to the Moon" last year. Palmer said he's grown tired of being "dragged" into conversations about Dogecoin. "Even when I had completely deleted all social media, [conversations about Dogecoin] continued to follow me," he added.

326.title: RPF personnel helps specially-abled passenger board train in TN; video surfaces
326.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a video on Twitter showing a Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel helping a specially-abled passenger board a train at Tamil Nadu's Virudhachalam station. "Wonderful gesture by Saravanan, Sub-Inspector, RPF...We need more people like him," Sahu wrote. "Carrying passenger like this is risky for both passenger and Sub-Inspector," Asian Para Games gold medallist Ekta Bhyan wrote.

327.title: Over 5 cr items are bought for gifting during Diwali season: CAIT
327.article_body: Traders' body CAIT has said over five crore items are purchased for gifting during every Diwali season. CAIT urged people to buy souvenirs inscribed with 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav', celebrating 75 years of Independence. "CAIT through its [over] 40,000 affiliate associations will connect with, potters...startups...and others to...produce a variety of quality products at affordable prices," it said.

328.title: Kangana Ranaut remembers J Jayalalithaa on one year of 'Thalaivii'
328.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to share a post marking one year since the release of her film 'Thalaivii'. "As Thalaivii completes one year remembering the iconic leader Purchai Thalaivi Dr J Jayalalithaa," she wrote, while sharing a still from the film. Directed by AL Vijay, it was based on the life of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa.

329.title: Indian Railways revenue up 38% to ₹95,486.58 crore till Aug-end
329.article_body: Railways Ministry has said the overall revenue of Indian Railways at the end of August 2022 was ₹95,486.58 crore. This is over 38% or ₹26,271.29 crore as compared to the corresponding period of last year, an official statement said. Further, the revenue from passenger traffic increased 116% year-on-year to ₹25,276.54 crore. Passenger traffic has also increased compared to last year.

330.title: Ailing activist Atikur Rahman’s mother demands his release
330.article_body: Activist Atikur Rahman's mother has demanded his release from jail, saying that she was "concerned for his life". Rahman was arrested in 2020 en route to Hathras, along with journalist Siddique Kappan, and at the time was receiving treatment for a heart condition. His wife, Sanjida, asked the judiciary to step in and grant him bail owing to his ill-health.

331.title: PM Modi to attend SCO summit in Uzbekistan on Sept 15-16
331.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will visit Samarkand in Uzbekistan to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit on September 15 and 16, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Sunday. Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin are among the leaders expected at the meeting. PM Modi is likely to hold bilateral meetings on the sidelines of the Summit.

332.title: Minor boy from UP seeks SC permission to donate liver to father
332.article_body: A minor boy in Uttar Pradesh filed a plea in the Supreme Court seeking permission to donate his liver to his father, who is currently critically ill. Only adults and deceased minors can donate organs, as per The Transplantation of Human Organs Act, 1994. The apex court has issued a notice to the UP government over the boy's plea.

333.title: We expect from Haaland what we expected from Ronaldo, Messi: Saha
333.article_body: Talking about Erling Haaland, ex-Manchester United striker Louis Saha said everyone expects the same results from the Manchester City forward what they expected from Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi for their respective teams for a long time. "For me, that's great. It's great for world football," he added. Haaland has scored 10 goals in six Premier League appearances so far.

334.title: US planes with relief material land in Pakistan's Sindh province
334.article_body: Two US military aircraft carrying relief supplies for those affected by the recent floods in Pakistan landed at Sukkur Airport in Sindh province on Sunday, Pakistani authorities said. Each plane brought in around 35 tons of relief aid, authorities added. It is estimated that millions have been left homeless by the floods that have battered Pakistan since mid-June.

335.title: Ranveer Singh dances on 'Pushpa' song at SIIMA 2022, video viral
335.article_body: A video of Ranveer Singh dancing to the song 'Srivalli' from the film 'Pushpa: The Rise' at the South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA) 2022 has gone viral on social media. In another video, Ranveer also recited Allu Arjun's dialogue from the film. Reacting to Ranveer's dance, a fan wrote on Instagram, "Is he a man or a glucose bottle?"

336.title: Indigenous stealth guided-missile frigate 'Taragiri' launched
336.article_body: India's indigenously-designed Nilgiri-class stealth guided-missile frigate 'Taragiri' has been launched on Sunday. It is the third stealth frigate built as part of Project 17A, under which a series of such frigates are being constructed. The 149-metre-long ship is propelled by two gas turbines and two main diesel engines and will be fitted with a supersonic surface-to-surface missile system.

337.title: Man picks up sleeping 3-year-old from house in MP, rapes her
337.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a man who picked her up while she was asleep in her house at a village in Madhya Pradesh's Katni district on Sunday, police said. Villagers claimed that a man who worked in a cement factory and lived in the neighbourhood had committed the crime, he added.

338.title: 6 dead after U'khand panchayat poll candidate distributes hooch
338.article_body: At least six people have died in the last three days after allegedly consuming illicit liquor distributed by a panchayat election candidate in Uttarakhand, Haridwar SP (Rural) Parmendra Singh Dobhal said. "Two more deaths have been reported in the concerned villages, but we cannot confirm if these are liquor-related deaths," Dobhal added. The candidate's husband has been arrested.

339.title: Group of men beat up doctor, his son for opening clinic door late in Maha, video surfaces
339.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a group of men beating up a doctor and his son for opening the clinic door late in Maharashtra's Baramati. The men were reportedly related to a patient. The police has registered a case against four people for the assault. A probe into the doctor's complaint is underway.

340.title: Songs 'Teri Ore', 'Dus Bahane' were shot in 6 hrs: Choreographer Bosco
340.article_body: Bollywood choreographer Bosco Martis revealed songs 'Dus Bahane' from 'Dus' and 'Teri Ore' from 'Singh Is Kinng' were shot in six hours. "'Teri Ore' was done in six hours, with Katrina Kaif changing, we were in Egypt, we had to shoot the pyramids...there was a lot to shoot," he said. "It's funny that they became popular," he further added.

341.title: It's funny: Uma Bharti on Kamal Nath's invite to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
341.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti on Sunday said she finds Congress leader Kamal Nath's invite for her to join the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' "funny". "I read in a newspaper that Kamal Nathji has invited me to join the Bharat Jodo Yatra...I am not used to such jokes," Bharti said. Congress has no right to undertake such a march, she added.

342.title: India demonstrated resilience in face of global energy crisis: Puri
342.article_body: India has demonstrated great resilience in the face of a global energy crisis, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. He further said fuel price rise in India has been contained in comparison to an exponential rise in developed countries. "Most...developed nations...[saw]...inflation rise in gasoline price by...40% [in] July-Aug' 22, while...India's gasoline price...reduced by 2.12%," he added.

343.title: Horse bred by Queen Elizabeth II wins race in US' Baltimore
343.article_body: A horse bred by Queen Elizabeth II won a race in US' Baltimore on Saturday, two days after the British monarch died. West Newton, a six-year-old gelding, rallied from sixth place to win by a half-length, his fourth victory in 19 races. Meanwhile, British horse racing resumed today after meetings were suspended for two days as a mark of respect.

344.title: Rejected 'Ponniyin...' as I wasn't in mental state to do it: Amala Paul
344.article_body: Actress Amala Paul revealed director Mani Ratnam took her audition for his film 'Ponniyin Selvan', however, she added that the film didn't happen at that time. "Then in 2021, he called me for the same project...I was not in the mental state to do it, so I had to turn it down," she added. The film will feature actor Vikram.

345.title: Article 370 can't be restored, won't mislead people: Ghulam Nabi Azad
345.article_body: Former J&K CM Ghulam Nabi Azad said Article 370, which granted special status to the erstwhile state, cannot be restored. Azad added he will not allow political parties to exploit people in the name of the revoked Act. The former Congress leader said he will not mislead people as restoring the Act requires a two-thirds majority in Parliament.

346.title: Golden time to invest in India: Goyal to business community in US
346.article_body: Interacting with the business community of Southern California, Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said this is a golden time to invest in India. Goyal further invited them all to be a part of India's journey towards becoming a developed nation. India as an economy in 2047 can be seen as a powerhouse driving global growth, he added.

347.title: Gained weight to get noticed by casting directors for plus-size roles: Soma
347.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actress Soma Rathod revealed that she was rejected in several auditions because she was "neither too thin nor too fat". "I gained weight to get noticed by casting directors for plus-size roles that aren't so common in our industry," Soma said, adding, "Being overweight, I've the benefit of roles specifically written with me in mind."

348.title: Improper that Maha CM Shinde and CJI UU Lalit shared a stage: MVA
348.article_body: The MVA alliance said it was "improper" and not "per protocol" that CJI UU Lalit shared a stage with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while the SC is hearing a case against him. Alliance leaders said this should not have happened while "legitimacy and legality of the Shinde government is being examined". The CJI was felicitated at the event on Saturday.

349.title: PM Modi's revdi culture of making VP: Congress on Malik's comment
349.article_body: Responding to Meghalaya governor Satya Pal Malik claiming he could have been Vice President if he stopped speaking against the government, the Congress said this was an example of PM Modi's "revdi culture".
