"Wah Modiji wah. You turned out to be a great artist. This is Modiji's freebie," said Congress. Malik had said that he will speak what he "feels".

350.title: Honoured & grateful: Kartik on winning Best Actor at OTTplay Awards
350.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan bagged the 'Best Actor' award for his role in 'Dhamaka' at the OTTplay Awards on Saturday. The actor took to Instagram to share a post after winning the award and wrote, "Best Actor #Dhamaka !! Thank you #HtOttAwards for recognising #ArjunPathak. Honoured and Grateful." Kartik played a reporter named Arjun Pathak in the film.

351.title: Uddhav's style of functioning responsible for split in Sena: Fadnavis
351.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis took a jibe at former CM Uddhav Thackeray, saying that his style of functioning was responsible for the split in the Shiv Sena. He also admitted that believing senior NCP leader Ajit Pawar was his "biggest" political blunder. "Uddhav Thackeray made a mockery of the mandate," Fadnavis added.

352.title: Army Chief Gen Manoj Pande flies in Apache helicopter on Ladakh visit
352.article_body: Indian Army Chief General Manoj Pande flew in an Indian Air Force Apache attack helicopter in the Ladakh sector on Sunday. The AH-64E Apache helicopter is equipped with the latest communications, navigation, sensor and weapon systems. General Pande reviewed the overall security situation in eastern Ladakh on the first day of his two-day visit to the Union Territory on Saturday.

353.title: Mali's leader demands 'compensation' for release of Ivorian soldiers
353.article_body: Mali's Interim President Assimi Goita has demanded "compensation" for Mali as part of resolution of an ongoing diplomatic conflict with Ivory Coast, state media reported. Ivory Coast has been calling for the release of 46 Ivorian soldiers in Mali's custody. Goita linked his demand with the fact that Ivory Coast has granted asylum to political figures wanted by Mali's junta.

354.title: When did I insult Hindu culture: Kamra to VHP on show cancellation
354.article_body: Two days after a bar in Gurugram cancelled comedian Kunal Kamra's show after members of the Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest, Kamra on Sunday wrote a letter to VHP. "When did I disrespect Hindu culture? If there is any clip or show, please show it to me as well," he wrote in the letter.

355.title: Prabhas breaks down after uncle Krishnam Raju's death, pic surfaces
355.article_body: Actor Prabhas broke down after the demise of his uncle, veteran actor and former Union Minister Krishnam Raju. Pictures and videos of him breaking down at the late actor's residence have surfaced online. Veteran actor Chiranjeevi can be seen consoling Prabhas and holding his hand. As per PTI, Krishnam Raju was suffering from post-COVID-19 ailments.

356.title: Security increased in Varanasi ahead of court order on Gyanvapi case
356.article_body: Ahead of the Varanasi district court's order on the Gyanvapi mosque case on Monday, prohibitory orders were put in place and security was tightened in the city. Both Hindu and Muslim sides concluded their arguments on the maintainability of the suit in August. Police have intensified checking in the district's border areas, hotels and guest houses.

357.title: Specially-abled Swiggy delivery agent delivers food in motorised wheelchair, video viral
357.article_body: A video of a specially-abled Swiggy delivery agent using a motorised wheelchair to deliver food has gone viral on social media. The video was reposted on Twitter by Swati Maliwal, Chairperson of Delhi Commission for Women, who praised the Swiggy delivery agent. "Of course life is difficult, but we have learned never to give up...Salute to this spirit," Maliwal wrote.

358.title: Future of women's tennis burns brightly: Billie Jean on Iga-Ons US Open final
358.article_body: Former tennis player Billie Jean King took to Twitter following Iga Swiatek's US Open win and wrote, "Congratulations to Iga Swiatek, the first Polish woman to win the US Open. And cheers to Ons Jabeur on an incredible battle." She added, "Future of women's tennis burns so brightly." Ex-Polish player Agnieszka Radwanska tweeted, "You just rock it!! Huge congratulations Swiatek."

359.title: Would never change anything about my journey: Actor Kartik Aaryan
359.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said that he will never change anything about his journey. "Thankfully I started when I was 20, almost like a child artist, but it's been a journey with ups and downs and I've seen hits and flops," he stated. Kartik added that he is enjoying the success of his recent films 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Dhamaka'.

360.title: Google Play Store’s new app review policy to bring more genuine reviews: Report
360.article_body: Google is reportedly bringing a new app review policy to make app ratings and reviews on Play Store more genuine. Under the policy, user-submitted reviews and ratings will be held up by around 24 hours before they go public. Google also warned against posting the same review multiple times as well as reviews for the same content from multiple accounts.

361.title: Indian cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy gets engaged to weightlifting coach, shares pics
361.article_body: India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy got engaged to performance coach and weightlifting coach Arjun Hoysala. The duo took to Instagram to share pictures, with Arjun writing, "And, she said 'Yes'." Arjun has also played a first-class match for Karnataka and has represented Belagavi Panthers in Karnataka Premier League.

362.title: Kareena praises 'Brahmastra', calls it an 'unbelievable experience'
362.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to Instagram Stories and praised Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "Unbelievable experience (five stars). Well done to the entire team," she wrote. Kareena watched the film with her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan and their son Taimur on Friday. The film has been released in five languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam.

363.title: Man throws slipper at mosque in Karnataka, video surfaces
363.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man throwing a slipper at a local mosque in Karnataka's Ballari district. Alok Kumar, Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, Karnataka, tweeted that the accused had been taken into custody. "Appropriate legal action is being taken against them," Kumar said.

364.title: WB CM Mamata says she's poor, but uses iPhone worth lakhs: BJP
364.article_body: BJP national vice president Dilip Ghosh took a jibe at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Abhishek Banerjee, for claiming to be poor, but using iPhones "worth lakhs of rupees". "Remember what 'Didimoni' (Mamata Banerjee) said? Talk on FaceTime. FaceTime is only available on iPhones. How many of you use FaceTime?" Ghosh said during a public meeting.

365.title: Soldier martyred as parachute fails to open during exercise in Leh
365.article_body: Paratrooper Naik Suraj Pal on Sunday was martyred after his parachute failed to open during a mountain strike exercise in the Leh-Ladakh region. "We salute the resolute courage of the paratrooper and stand by his family in this hour of grief," Indian Army's Central Command stated. Last week, a commando was martyred in a similar exercise in the Leh sector.

366.title: Salman's Mumbai house was recced by Sidhu Moosewala murder accused: Police
366.article_body: An accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case conducted a recce of actor Salman Khan's house in Mumbai on gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's instruction, police have said. This was revealed by the accused Kapil Pandit during his interrogation, Punjab Police DGP Gaurav Yadav said. A threat letter was sent to Salman and his father Salim in June this year.

367.title: PM condoles demise of Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swaroopanand Saraswati
367.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his grief at the demise of Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati on Sunday. "My condolences to his followers in this time of grief. Om Shanti!" PM Modi said. Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passed away at the age of 98 at the Shridham Jhoteshwar Ashram in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur.

368.title: 20-yr-old strangled to death by father over her romantic relationship in UP
368.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by her father for having a romantic relationship with a man in Uttar Pradesh's Jhinjhana, police said. The victim had eloped with her boyfriend and returned home after a few days. The father has confessed that he committed the crime as he felt his daughter had tarnished the name of his family.

369.title: Turkey says Greek Coast Guard fired on cargo ship amid tensions
369.article_body: A cargo ship sailing in international waters in the Aegean Sea came under fire from two Greek Coast Guard vessels on Saturday, the Turkish Coast Guard said. No casualties due to the shooting were reported. Lately, there has been a flare up in tensions between Greece and Turkey over Greek military deployment on several islands near the Turkish coast.

370.title: Challenge you to an open discussion on corruption: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
370.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Sunday challenged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to an "open discussion on corruption". "We are always ready. You fix the time and venue, and we will come," Siddaramaiah said.  "BJP leaders are claiming that they will expose scandals of our time. I challenge them to do that. I am ready to face it," he added.

371.title: Pakistan to bowl first in Asia Cup 2022 final against SL, playing XIs announced
371.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bowl first against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2022 final in Dubai. Pakistan have made two changes to their playing XI, with Shadab Khan and Naseem Shah returning to the side in place of Usman Qadir and Hasan Ali. Sri Lanka are fielding the same playing XI.

372.title: When I worked in Telugu films, actresses were for love scenes, songs: Amala
372.article_body: Actress Amala Paul, who worked in four Telugu films between 2011 and 2015, revealed that she could not connect with the Telugu film industry. "The kind of films that they were making...was very different. There would always be two actresses and we'd be there for the love scenes, songs," she added. "Everything was very glamorous," she further stated.

373.title: PM Modi is 'soul of country', can't be defeated: Maha Minister Khade
373.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Suresh Khade has claimed PM Narendra Modi was the "soul of the country" and was "undefeatable". "Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Indira Gandhi lost elections in their time, but Modi will never lose," Khade asserted. PM Modi lies in the hearts of the people of India, Khade further added.

374.title: Pune district reports 5 COVID-19 deaths during Ganesh Chaturthi
374.article_body: The Pune district reported five COVID-19 deaths during the 10-day-long Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. Health department officials said that due to the festivities, daily cases may rise over the next few days. Dr Pradeep Awate, state surveillance officer, urged people to wear masks and said, "At present, a subvariant of Omicron BA.2.75 is dominating other covid variants in the state."

375.title: Will soon launch national party, formulate its policies: T'gana CM
375.article_body: Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said he would launch a national party and formulate its policies soon. "There has been a consensus on the alternative national agenda after prolonged discussions with intellectuals, economists and experts from various fields like we did before the start of [the] Telangana movement," an official release from Rao's office said.

376.title: Pune Police recieve 1,043 noise complaints during Ganpati festival
376.article_body: The Pune Police received 1,043 noise complaints between August 31 and September 10, and the highest number of complaints were received on September 9, the final day of the Ganpati festival. Majority of the complaints were about loud music at Ganesh pandals beyond the 10 pm deadline. Police Commissioner, Amitabh Gupta, said that appropriate action will be taken.

377.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Mumbai predicting rains over next 2 days
377.article_body: The IMD has issued a fresh yellow alert for Mumbai predicting heavy rainfall with thunderstorms over the next two days. The department added that the temperatures in the city will increase, despite the rains. Meteorologists say Mumbai has recorded 174 mm of rain this month until September 9, which is comparatively on the lighter side.

378.title: Liberian national arrested for trafficking 3 Mumbai men to Myanmar
378.article_body: A Liberian national was arrested by Mumbai's Bandra Police for duping three people with job offers and getting them trafficked. Police say the man promised the three men a job in Thailand but once they reached there, their passports were confiscated and they were held captive inside a bunker in Myanmar. The MEA is currently working on getting them back.

379.title: 2 sisters jump from 11th floor of building in Noida; 1 dies
379.article_body: Two sisters allegedly jumped from the eleventh floor of a building in Noida's Sector-96 on Saturday, police said. The elder sister, aged around 18, died on the spot, while her younger sister, aged 17, was shifted to a hospital. Both of them reportedly got into a dispute with their family members and left the house before jumping off the building.

380.title: Rajpath erased from signboards near India Gate after being renamed
380.article_body: The old name of New Delhi's ceremonial avenue, Rajpath, has been taken off the signages mounted around the periphery of the India Gate hexagon after it was renamed 'Kartavya Path'. The move comes after the civic body recently issued a notice approving the renaming of the historic road at its special meeting on September 7.

381.title: Viral video shows King Charles gesturing angrily to aide to clear his desk
381.article_body: A video showing UK's King Charles III gesturing angrily to his aide to clear the desk during his accession ceremony has gone viral online. The 73-year-old is seen in the video prompting his aide to remove a tray of pens from his desk. He was proclaimed the King at the ceremony in St James's Palace, London.

382.title: Assam Congress leader Kamrul Islam Choudhury resigns from party
382.article_body: Assam Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) General Secretary Kamrul Islam Choudhury resigned from the party's primary membership on Sunday. In a letter to party chief Sonia Gandhi, he said the present instability of Congress in Assam due to directionless and confused leadership of APCC during the last few months has left no reason for him to continue as the party's member.

383.title: Alia shares videos of audiences throwing confetti during Brahmastra screening
383.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories and re-posted a couple of videos showing viewers throwing confetti during the screening of 'Brahmastra' in theatres. In a video, fans could be seen cheering and throwing confetti as 'Allari Motha', the Telugu version of 'Dance Ka Bhoot', played on the screen. According to makers, 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹160 crore globally.

384.title: Was extremely nervous: Shiamak Davar recalls meeting Queen Elizabeth II
384.article_body: Choreographer Shiamak Davar, condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, said, "I'd heard she was ailing. When she passed away, I felt very sad." He also recalled meeting the Queen in 2017 and said he was "extremely nervous". "I was wondering what I should wear...Though it was formal, I made it Indian because I'm proud to be Indian," said Shiamak.

385.title: 2 interstate drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, 1 litre of hash oil seized
385.article_body: Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram Police on September 9 arrested two interstate drug peddlers from Sushma crossroads. The accused purchased 1 litre of hash oil from a drug dealer in Visakhapatnam for ₹40,000. The police arrested them while the two were waiting to board a bus to Hyderabad. The accused concealed the hash oil container in a bag to evade the police.

386.title: Delhi Police van rams into scooty, accused of destroying evidence; 2 hurt
386.article_body: A video showing a Delhi Police van ramming into a scooty and injuring two women has surfaced online. The women have alleged that the police personnel were in an inebriated condition and also tried to wipe the blood off the road to destroy incriminating evidence. They also offered money to the victims to not lodge a complaint, reports said.

387.title: 3 killed as US-made Black Hawk crashes during Taliban exercise
387.article_body: A US-made Black Hawk helicopter crashed during a training exercise in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Saturday, killing three Afghan crew members, the Taliban's Defence Ministry said. Another five people were injured in the incident, the ministry added. Several US-manufactured military equipment, including helicopters, were seized by the Taliban after US forces withdrew from Afghanistan last year.

388.title: Sky is the limit: World no. 1 Swiatek after her maiden US Open win
388.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek said the "sky is the limit" after winning her maiden US Open title. "It's something that I wasn't expecting for sure...I'm proud, also surprised a little bit. Just happy that I was able to do that," she added. Swiatek beat Ons Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5) in final. Overall, it was the 21-year-old's third Grand Slam title.

389.title: Kejriwal, corruption synonymous; he has no right to remain CM: BJP
389.article_body: The BJP on Sunday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and corruption have become synonymous, adding that he has no right to remain in the post. "How can you claim to be 'hardcore honest'? People have understood you are 'hardcore corrupt'. You have no right to remain in the chair of the CM," said BJP's national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

390.title: Blindly adopting tech could be counterproductive: RBI Executive Director
390.article_body: The Executive Director of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Ajay Choudhary, said that the financial sector "blindly" adopting latest technologies without understanding the biases could be counterproductive. "RBI’s focus area is innovation, while innovations are desirable they also need to be responsible," he added. Choudhary said that the risks posed by new innovations should be well understood.

391.title: Akhtar shares 'BP monitor, inhaler, tablets' meme ahead of Pak-SL final, says 'All ready?'
391.article_body: Ahead of the Pakistan-Sri Lanka Asia Cup 2022 final, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to share a meme showing a BP monitoring device, an inhaler and tablets with the caption, "All set for Asia Cup 2022 final". Akhtar wrote, "Sab tayyar? (All ready?)" A fan jokingly commented, "Get ready to break TVs as well."

392.title: I tell daughter Palak not to marry, I don't believe in it: Shweta Tiwari
392.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari revealed she tells her daughter Palak Tiwari not to get married. Shweta added she doesn't believe in the institution of marriage. Shweta has divorced Raja Chaudhary and Abhinav Kohli in the past. "I want her to think well before taking the plunge. Just because you're in a relationship, it doesn't have to culminate into marriage," she stated.

393.title: Sorry state of affairs: HC to Delhi govt on plea of kids suffering from cerebral palsy
393.article_body: Delhi High Court has warned the AAP-led Delhi government of action over the plea of two children, seeking support under disabilities law. Terming it a sorry state of affairs, Justice Gaurang Kanth said it "miserably failed" to carry out its duty as "State" towards the children. He noted the Delhi government "wasn't in a position to consider" their case positively.

394.title: Man kills wife with frying pan in Noida for refusing to cook food
394.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife with a frying pan in their house at Shramik Kunj in Noida's sector 66 area on Saturday morning, after she refused to cook food for him. The couple was alone in the house when the incident took place, reports said. The couple's neighbour informed the police about the crime.

395.title: Delhi needs more educated LG: AAP as LG approves CBI probe in alleged bus scam
395.article_body: After Delhi LG VK Saxena approved a CBI probe into the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by Delhi Transport Corporation, AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "Delhi needs a more educated LG." "[He] has no clue what he's signing on," Bharadwaj said. "[He's] facing many serious allegations of corruption...To divert attention, he's making such enquiries," Bharadwaj added.

396.title: Reliance can explore reorganisation to list subsidiaries: Report
396.article_body: A Kotak Institutional Equities report has said that Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd can explore the reorganisation of the company into three independent entities for different verticals to list subsidiaries. It added that this would help prevent any holding company discount in Reliance as and when it lists subsidiaries. It would also help Reliance prepare for eventual management change.

397.title: I wasn't even considered for my role in 'Jersey': Prit Kamani
397.article_body: Actor Prit Kamani, speaking about his role in 'Jersey', has said that he was not even considered in 'Jersey' as he was already playing the lead in other projects. "For me, no role is big or small...'Jersey' is a special film since I am very close to my father as I wanted to give something back to him," he stated.

398.title: US Open champ Iga's tweet on spotting 'Friends' actor Perry during final goes viral
398.article_body: World number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek's tweet on spotting 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry during the US Open 2022 final has gone viral. Sharing a GIF of Perry's character 'Chandler Bing' from Friends, Iga wrote, "Me when I really wanted to be focused but I saw @MatthewPerry on the screen during the changeover. Could this BE any more exciting?"

399.title: They are not letting the model set: Ramiz Raja on India not reaching Asia Cup final
399.article_body: Talking about India failing to reach Asia Cup 2022 final, Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said, "India went down only because they are not letting the model set. They are making too many changes." He added, "They have a bigger pool of players with which they are experimenting." He further attributed Pakistan's success to not changing the winning model.

400.title: Wonderful that we don't live in time where language is barrier: Ranveer
400.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh won the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India award at the South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA). While receiving the award, Ranveer said, "There used to be a time when language was a barrier, but how wonderful it is that we don't live in such a time anymore." Actor Allu Arjun won the Best Actor award.

401.title: Link startups with industry as equal stakeholders: Jitendra Singh
401.article_body: In order to ensure sustainable startups, Minister of State for Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh, said that startups and industry should be linked from the beginning as equal stakeholders. He added that his Ministry was reaching out to startups and providing seed funding for incubation and quality research. Singh also said that India currently ranks third in the startup ecosystem.

402.title: 14 gold bars weighing over 2 kg seized from Assam bus, 3 held
402.article_body: In a joint operation, Assam Police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) arrested three people and seized 14 gold bars weighing 2.323 kg from a passenger bus in Karbi Anglong district on Saturday night. A naka checking was set up by the police and CRPF personnel at the Lahorijan area based on secret information.
